email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Spot Business Booking
email_chain.body: Morning Gary, I'm interested in securing some spot business that can fit into your schedule for September, October, or November. Could you please advise on your earliest availability during these months and confirm if you offer any demurrage flexibility? Regards, Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Spot Business Booking
email_chain.body: Morning Mark, Hi, We can offer you a spot in October. September and November are fully booked. Could you clarify your requirements so I can check with our operations team for the exact availabilities in October? Thank you, Jen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Spot Business Booking
email_chain.body: Morning Jen, October works for us. We would need a capacity for approximately 3000 TEUs for 15 days, including a 24-hour turnaround time. Could you please confirm if this is possible? Regards, Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Spot Business Booking
email_chain.body: Morning Mark, Hello, We can indeed offer you the required capacity of 3000 TEUs. We are also able to extend the hire period to 30 days with no extra charge for demurrage. Could you please confirm if you would like to proceed under these terms? Regards, Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Spot Business Booking
email_chain.body: Morning Gary, That's excellent. We would be happy to proceed with 3000 TEUs for 30 days under the terms you mentioned. Please send over the contract details at your earliest convenience. Regards, Mark

email_chain.subject: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: Mr. Singer, Could you please provide a quote for transporting 2,000MT of LNG from Skikda, Algeria, to any port in Hong Kong? Could you also inform us on the earliest delivery date? Best regards, Angel

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: Mr. Angel, Thank you for your inquiry. Before proceeding, could you please confirm if Skikda is the loading port? Kind regards, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: John, Yes, we are considering Skikda for LNG exports as it is Algeria's largest LNG terminal. Regards, Angel

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: Angel, Thank you for confirming. We are open to handling shipments from all ports in Algeria, including Skikda. Regards, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: John, To answer your earlier question, Skikda is located on the northeastern coast of Algeria. Best regards, Angel

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: Angel, Is Skikda port equipped for direct transfers to ocean-going vessels, or will the LNG need transportation by land before it is loaded onto the ship? Kind regards, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: John, The LNG will be transported directly from the facilities at Skikda port onto the vessel. There is no need for additional land transportation within Algeria. Best regards, Angel

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: Angel, Understood. Could you please specify which port in Hong Kong the vessel should head to? Best regards, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: John, The cargo can be offloaded at any operational port in Hong Kong capable of receiving LNG shipments. Regards, Angel

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LNG Transport Quotation from Algeria to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: Angel, Thank you for the information. I will prepare the detailed shipping quotation and send it to you shortly. Kind regards, John

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about LNG Transportation from Anjouan to Dunkirk

Can we meet tomorrow or Tuesday? Thanks, Ross

I realize you've been addressing this, could you please re-evaluate the current status and prepare a report? I need to discuss this at next month’s team meeting. If it’s easier, I can also coordinate with Morgan. Apologies for the hassle. Let me know if you need more info. Best, Anna

labels.broker: Mr. Green with Daniel James as his replacement

email_chain.body:

I am sourcing a 1,000MT cargo of NZC wets for next month and also arranging to ship a 2,000MT cargo of fertilizer from the 23rd to the 30th of November. I would appreciate it if you could inform me about any vessel availability for these shipments.

email_chain.subject: Potential Collaboration and Business Opportunities
email_chain.body: Dear Messrs Rettig and Nogales, I've heard rumors about your discussions to form a new entity and would like to confirm if this is correct. Such a partnership could indeed bring tremendous added value to the industry. Assuming this goes forward, it might be an opportune time for us to consider increasing our activity levels on HUB. However, this would necessitate significant improvements in your operational efficiency. I am keen to understand more about your upgrade plans and how they could support our expanded engagement. Best regards, Ira

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Collaboration and Business Opportunities
email_chain.body: Dear Ira, Thank you for reaching out. Indeed, we are in advanced discussions to form a new entity that we believe will offer real value to the industry. We appreciate your consideration of increased volumes on HUB and understand the implications for operational efficiency. We are currently planning significant upgrades to our systems and processes and would be glad to discuss how these could meet your needs for enhanced activity levels. Best regards, Paul

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation: 8,000 Tons of Rice Shipment from Yangon to Abidjan
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Njie,

Could you please provide us with a quotation for the shipment of 8,000 tons of rice from Yangon to Abidjan? We would require details on the following aspects:
1. Charter rate for full, one-time charter over 15 days.
2. Stipulations and arrangements regarding the charter.
3. Expected time of delivery.
4. Applicable duty rate.
5. Information on the average draft.
6. Details of discharging gear and the size of the hatch.
Additionally, could you provide a list of other commodities currently carried by your vessel? Please send back the quotation for our review and signature.

Yours faithfully,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation: 4,000 Tons of Sugar Shipment from Singapore to Luanda
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

Please provide us with a quotation for shipping 4,000 tons of sugar from Singapore to Luanda, including:
1. Charter rate for full, one-time over 15 days.
2. Stipulations and arrangements for the shipment.
3. Expected delivery time.
4. Applicable duty rate.
5. Average draft of the vessel.
6. Discharging gear and hatch size information.
We would also require a list of other commodities transported by your vessel. Kindly send back the detailed rate for our confirmation and signature.

Yours faithfully,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Shipping Request for 47 deg API Crude from Drillship Amazon

We intend to ship this cargo to Long Beach via Panamax in the third week of November. As we are finalizing the quantity, could you please advise on the expected requirements for such a shipment? Regards, Russell

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request for 47 deg API Crude from Drillship Amazon

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request for 47 deg API Crude from Drillship Amazon
email_chain.body: Dear Nitish, I've forwarded your inquiry to our operations team to obtain a quotation. I will revert once the quote is received. Thank you. Regards, Russell

email_chain.subject: Request for Storage and Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Basil,
Could you handle 5,400MT of vegetable oil from Aqaba to Mombasa, with full documentation? Additionally, could you let me know your storage fee in Mombasa? 
Regards,
Sina

email_chain.subject: RE: Request for Storage and Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Sina,
Thank you for your email. We can handle your storage in Mombasa. The storage price is $1.2/MT for a month for a total quantity of 5,400MTs. We also offer cargo delivery by truck directly to your factory, and the price varies depending on the distance. For example, from Mombasa port to Machakos (70 km), the price is $40/MT and from Mombasa to Athi River (50 km), the price is $30/MT.
Regards,
Basil

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation: 15,000 DWT Vessel

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation: 15,000 DWT Vessel

email_chain.subject: Re: Re: Request for Quotation: 15,000 DWT Vessel
email_chain.body: Hello Nicole, Please confirm the following: 1) The cargo is furnace oil, not gas oil. 2) The vessel meets the specification and class as per the samples provided. Regards, Liam

email_chain.subject: Clarification of Cargo Type and Vessel Condition
email_chain.body: Nicole, To clarify our stance on the cargo: 1) We will only accept FURNACE OIL shipments. 2) Ensure the cargo is in compliance with high-class and condition standards, as we only accept high-quality petroleum products. Regards, Liam

email_chain.subject: Ammonia Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body: Good day Mr. March, we’re interested in booking 11,500MT of ammonia from Yuzhny to Tampa, and would like a price quote. Could we also schedule another 4,000MT from Klaipeda to Belize? Regards, Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Ammonia Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Michael, We received your request for shipping 11,500MT of ammonia from Yuzhny to Tampa, USA, and 4,000MT from Klaipeda to Belize. Could you please provide the end buyer details and specific charter requirements for this? Regards, James

email_chain.subject: Re: Ammonia Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Michael, To proceed with your booking, we would need the following documents for the shipments: Master Bill of Lading signed by the ship captain, ship's commercial documents, and the seller's Letter of Guarantee. Please provide these at your earliest convenience. Regards, James

email_chain.subject: Re: Ammonia Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear James, We are currently compiling all the required documents. Meanwhile, could you provide us with your bank account details for the payment? Regards, Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Ammonia Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Michael, Thank you for your prompt response. We are sending you our bank account details for the payment for the ammonia shipments. Please confirm once you receive this information. Regards, James

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

I hope this message finds you well. Can you provide the current freight quote for shipping coal from Newcastle to Hamburg? We are considering a bulk cargo of about 75,000 MT. Additionally, please advise on the vessel details and expected laytime.

Best regards,
Samantha Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Samantha,

Thank you for reaching out. The current freight quote for shipping 75,000 MT of coal from Newcastle to Hamburg is approximately $20 per tonne. The ideal vessel for this shipment is the MV Global Trader, which has a DWT of 80,000 MT and an LOA of 225 meters. Expected laytime is from February 5, 2023, to February 10, 2023. Freight rates are subject to final confirmation.

Best, 
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Request for Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Becky, Please consider these details. We’d like to ship 2,100MT of soya beans. Laycan period is pending confirmation. Our requirement is 15,000 bags for the upcoming months. Kind regards, Joanna

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body: Thanks Joanna for your email. I’ve spoken to my superiors, and we are willing to ship to your specified location if we can agree on the price previously discussed for another destination. Are you happy with that price? I also have another client interested at a higher price but they can’t cover freight costs. Hope to hear from you soon. Regards, Becky

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Becky, Have you spoken to your sales manager about matching the price we quoted for another shipment? Kind regards, Joanna

email_chain.subject: Re: Price Match Inquiry
email_chain.body: I have spoken to our sales manager but he is not willing to reduce the price. We can sell at our current price but we are not going to reduce it for your shipment. Please let us know if you are willing to accept the current price. Regards, Becky

email_chain.subject: Acceptance of Current Price and Further Details
email_chain.body: We are willing to pay the current price. Can you help me with the terms and conditions of the contract? Thanks, Jon

email_chain.subject: Re: Acceptance of Current Price and Further Details
email_chain.body: We can provide all the terms you need. Please let us know if you need our sample contract as well. Kind regards, Becky

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Terms and Conditions
email_chain.body: I am new here. Can I see your terms and conditions for our contract? Thanks, Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Terms and Conditions
email_chain.body: We are happy to share our terms and conditions with you. Can I please get your contact details? Kind regards, Matt

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Shipping Options and Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Kari,

I'm starting to schedule a shipment of biodegradable plastic from Adelaide to Melbourne and I'm wondering if we can talk about the carrier options and rates.

Best,
Claudia

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Options and Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Claudia,

Sure, I would love to discuss this with you. What works for you? Also, are you located on the east or west coast?

Best,
Kari

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Options and Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Kari,

I am on the west coast, in Adelaide. Here's a little more info on the shipment: The product is packed in a rectangular container that's about 1 cubic meter and weighs approximately 30 kgs. There is a second product in this shipment, made of paper, that's heavier, about 30 kilos. In total, the shipment is about 2 x 1m long. I would like to get a quote for air freight.

Can we discuss this further?

Best,
Claudia

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Options and Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Claudia,

Thank you for the details. Let's set up a time to discuss the air freight options for your shipment.

Best,
Kari

email_chain.subject: Link to Product Sample
email_chain.body:
Hi Kari,

Here is a website where you can see a sample of the product: [link]. It looks like paper, but it is a non-recycled biodegradable plastic.

Best,
Claudia

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote: Wheat Flour from Mersin to Panamá City
email_chain.body: Good morning Mr. Vasquez, We'd like to load 3,000MT of wheat flour from Mersin to Panamá City, and freight pre-paid on FOB basis. Could you provide your best quote for this shipment? With kindest regards, Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote: Wheat Flour from Mersin to Panamá City
email_chain.body: Hi Sam, I can confirm we are ready to proceed with your request. Please let me know if you need further details. Kind regards, Richard

email_chain.subject: Clarification Needed: Storage Arrangements
email_chain.body: Good morning Richard, Just a quick question, was the cargo stored under our nominated agent? Thanks, Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification Needed: Storage Arrangements
email_chain.body: Hi Sam, Yes, it was stored under your nominated agent. However, it arrived earlier today at another warehouse in a different part of town. Can I call you now, or would you prefer to come in later? Kind regards, Richard

email_chain.subject: Concerns Regarding Customs
email_chain.body: Hi Richard, Are there any risk of the shipment getting stranded at customs? Kind regards, Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Concerns Regarding Customs
email_chain.body: Hi Sam, I'm afraid there is a risk of the shipment being stranded at customs. I have forwarded your details to a colleague who will update you once the status of the shipment has changed. Apologies for the inconvenience. Kind regards, Richard

email_chain.subject: Update: Customs Status for Your Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sam, Great news. The customs issue has been resolved, and your shipment is clear. Let us know if there is anything else we can assist with. Regards.

email_chain.subject: Loading Details for [Vessel Name] ([IMO #])
email_chain.body:
Hello [Shipper Name],

A vessel, the [Vessel Name] ([IMO #]), is currently awaiting loading of a shipment of [Cargo Name] at [Port of Loading], bound for [Port of Discharge]. The vessel is scheduled to depart on [Scheduled Departure Date].

Please ensure that the loading of the following cargo is completed within the specified [Loading Timeframe]:

[Cargo Name]: [Volume] MT.

The estimated cost of this shipment is [Estimated Cost] USD.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

email_chain.subject: Update on Loading Progress for [Vessel Name] ([IMO #])
email_chain.body:
Hello [Shipper Name],

Following up on our discussions, the vessel [Vessel Name] ([IMO #]) is still at [Port of Loading] and prepared to depart on [Scheduled Departure Date].

We have been informed of delays in the loading process, but the expected completion is still within the originally communicated [Loading Timeframe].

Based on the latest information, the total estimated cost for this shipment remains as [Estimated Cost] USD.

Should you have any questions or require further clarification, please feel free to reach out.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
[Company Name]

email_chain.subject: Availability Query for Vessel Transporting Crude Oil
email_chain.body:
Good Morning,

We have a cargo of 150,000 MT of crude oil named 'XONE' scheduled to depart from Vung Tau on 22nd September onboard a Hapag Lloyd vessel. Could you please confirm if your vessel is available for this shipment?

We appreciate your assistance.

Best regards,
Natalie

email_chain.subject: Re: Availability Query for Vessel Transporting Crude Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Natalie,

Thank you for reaching out. Our vessel 'Venezuela' is indeed available to transport the cargo 'XONE' from Vung Tau, Vietnam on the specified date. Could you please confirm the shipment details and how you would like to proceed?

Looking forward to your prompt reply.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

email_chain.subject: Re: Availability Query for Vessel Transporting Crude Oil
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Thank you for your prompt response. I am pleased to hear that the 'Venezuela' is available. Our product originates from Vung Tau, and we would like to confirm this as the port of origin for the shipment. Please let us know the next steps for securing the vessel for our cargo.

Thank you again for your assistance.

Best regards,
Natalie

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipment Handling on Specific Laycan Date
email_chain.body: Dear Ms. Weber, We are preparing a shipment for 4,000MT of goods from Xiamen to Las Palmas. Could you please inform us if you have the capacity to handle this shipment on the specified laycan? We look forward to your prompt reply. Thank you, Yannick

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Shipment Capabilities for Xiamen to Las Palmas
email_chain.body: Dear Pia, I am reaching out to confirm whether you can accommodate a 4,000MT shipment from Xiamen to Las Palmas on our desired laycan dates. Your confirmation will be greatly appreciated. Regards, Yannick

email_chain.subject: Capacity Confirmation for 4,000MT Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Monika, We are planning to transport a 4,000MT shipment from Xiamen to Las Palmas and would be grateful if you could let us know whether you can cover this on our specified laycan. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Best regards, Yannick

email_chain.subject: Shipment Handling Request for 4,000MT from Xiamen to Las Palmas
email_chain.body: Dear Edina, As part of our ongoing logistics needs, we are arranging a shipment of 4,000MT from Xiamen to Las Palmas. Could you please confirm if you have the capability of handling this shipment on the planned laycan dates? I look forward to hearing from you soon. Sincerely, Yannick

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Availability and Demurrage Rates in May
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ambrose,

We are planning to ship 50,000MT of grain from Vancouver to Bordeaux in May. Could you please provide information on any available empty vessels during that period, along with your latest demurrage rates? Looking forward to your prompt response.

Regards,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability and Demurrage Rates in May
email_chain.body:
Hello Adam,

Vessel availability for departure in May 2023 will be limited, especially around mid-May. I encourage you to advise on your preferred vessels and any other vessels you are considering. Despite the limited availability, we can accommodate your shipping needs. Please note, our demurrage rates can vary, and we would appreciate specifics concerning your usual rates or any other vessels of interest.

For further inquiries, feel free to contact our Chartering department. Also, keep an eye on the Baltic Dry Index (BDI), which has reached a 9-month peak and continues to climb.

Thank you,
Ms. Ambrose

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Availability - Caustic Soda Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Wu, 

Could you advise if you have a suitable vessel available for transporting 8,000MT of caustic soda from Port Klang to Port Dickson next month? Your confirmation of vessel availability for this shipment would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,
Cecile

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Caustic Soda - Additional Details
email_chain.body:
Hi,

It's great to connect again. I will be handling the logistics for this shipment from Port Klang to Port Dickson. We are considering utilizing the vessel 'Da Shan' which has a deadweight of 15,000dwt. Please see the details below:

- Vessel's Name: Da Shan
- Port of Loading: Port Klang
- Commodity: Caustic Soda
- Quantity: 8000MT
- Delivery Date: July 1st, 2009
- Quoted Price: USD 2.6 - 2.8/mt FOB
- Shipping Terms: CIF

Please confirm if you can accommodate this shipment under these conditions. A prompt response would be appreciated.

Thanks,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability - Caustic Soda Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Cecile,

Good to hear from you. Our vessel 'Da Shan' is available and can be loaded at Selangor with 8000mt of caustic soda on July 1st. Could you please provide your actual FOB price for this shipment? If your price is competitive, we will proceed with the booking.

Best regards,
Mr. Wu

email_chain.subject: Loading Location Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi,

We received your reply regarding the vessel's availability. Could you confirm if you are able to load the caustic soda at Port Klang instead of Selangor? If so, please provide us with the revised quotation immediately.

Thanks,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Location Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Steve,

Thanks for your prompt response. I am currently verifying if the 'Da Shan' is still available for the caustic soda shipment on July 1st. I will confirm the loading details shortly.

Best,
Cecile

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Bitumen Shipment from Yanbu to Jeddah
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Dorsey,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to inquire if you have space available this week for a 4,800MT shipment of bitumen from Yanbu to Jeddah. Additionally, could you please inform us if demurrage might be an issue? Looking forward to your prompt response.

Cheers,
Adam

P.S. We are still awaiting payment for your last coal shipment from the previous month. Could you please provide us with a payment confirmation date?

Warm regards,
Zoe Cortez

email_chain.subject: Marketing Idea Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Dorsey,

I got an interesting marketing strategy for our communications. How about this message for a campaign:

'Let’s do business.
It’s easy.
Get rich.
Act now or be left behind.'

Feel free to modify the last line as per your preference. Try substituting your email address in place of [X] and see the feedback.

Looking forward to your thoughts,
[Y]

P.S. Please respond to ensure you receive further updates on this.

email_chain.subject: Exclusive Offer Just for You
email_chain.body:
Mr. Dorsey,

Here’s a compelling proposition for you: 'Send money today, and get a luxurious gift in return.' Click here to get started.

Please ensure you reply to this message so you don’t miss out on future communications!

All the best,
[X]

P.S. This is an automatically generated message. Please do not respond directly as you may not receive a response.

email_chain.subject: Opportunity for High-Earners
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I am reaching out to discuss an opportunity that I believe may intrigue you, knowing your interest in high-earning ventures. This is not a spam message, nor will it direct you to unwarranted sites.

I look forward to discussing this with you further and exploring potential interests that align with your goals.

Sincerely,
[Your Contact]

email_chain.subject: Important Personal Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I felt it necessary to relay some sensitive but vital information concerning your personal circumstances. This is not a trick, and I am not an adversary. Please read through this carefully as it concerns a personal matter directly affecting you.

Best regards,
A Trusted Friend

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for LNG Vessel Charter from Ras Laffan to Jebel Ali
email_chain.body:
Please advise if you have a suitable vessel for 5,000MT of LNG from Ras Laffan to Jebel Ali by 10th September. I would also appreciate an indication of whether you allow part cargo.
Regards,
Miguel

email_chain.subject: Urgent Requirement for LNG Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
We need to arrange delivery of a 5,000m3 LNG cargo from Ras Laffan to Jebel Ali, aiming for mid-September arrival. Can you confirm the availability of a vessel for this shipment? Timely delivery is crucial as the cargo will not be required if delayed.
Kind regards,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Long-Term Charter Inquiry for 5,000 m3 LNG Vessel
email_chain.body:
We are interested in discussing a long-term charter for a 5,000 m3 LNG vessel. Would your company be interested in this opportunity?
Regards,
Ashok

email_chain.subject: Enquiry for LNG Tanker Purchase or Charter
email_chain.body:
Do you have an LNG tanker available for sale or charter? We are looking to acquire a vessel with conversion options for LNG, LPG, or Gas. I appreciate your response.
Best wishes,
James Davidson

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Carrier Operations to Corfu
email_chain.body:
Hello Joe,

Is your carrier going to Corfu this season?

Thanks,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Seasons in Corfu
email_chain.body:
Hey Sheryl,

Have you noticed how the seasons change in Corfu? Are you sure this is the place that you want to spend the rest of your life?

George

email_chain.subject: Restaurant Inquiry in Corfu
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir or Madam,

Do you have a restaurant, and if so, what are the costs of your meals and what kind of food do you serve? If you do not have a restaurant, could you inform me about other dining options in that area?

With sincere regards,
Mary

email_chain.subject: Request for CIF Quote - Heptanes Container
email_chain.body: Hi, I am looking for one 20-foot container of heptanes shipped from Los Angeles. The import terminal is TDL, and we'd appreciate a CIF quote for Trieste. Kind regards, Stefania

email_chain.subject: Advance Payment Order Issue - TwinCap 153
email_chain.body: Hi, I would like to confirm the issuance of the first Advance Payment Order on the TwinCap 153 cargo related to the contract dated from February 24, 2011. Best regards, Valentijn

email_chain.subject: Update on TwinCap 153 Cargo Issue Date
email_chain.body: Hi, I would like to note that due to a clerical error, the first Advance Payment Order on the TwinCap 153 cargo was mistakenly issued on March 24, 2011, instead of March 25, 2011, as per our contract. The order remains valid despite this discrepancy. Best regards, Valentijn

email_chain.subject: Re: Update on TwinCap 153 Cargo Issue Date
email_chain.body: Hi Valentijn, In reference to your message regarding the TwinCap 153 cargo, I have noted the details about the Advance Payment Order issue dates and the clerical error involved. Best regards, G.

email_chain.subject: Transportation Request for Caustic Soda
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rudi,

I hope this message finds you well. I am reaching out to inquire if you could assist with the transportation of a few hundred metric tonnes of caustic soda from Limassol to Monrovia, targeted for the end of July. Your help in this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: In Appreciation of Ms. Shana
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Shana,

I would like to express my gratitude for your diligent management of the financial assistance grant as requested by our foundation. Your efforts have notably benefited individuals in need, such as a mother who required funding for her children's school fees, clothing, and other necessities.

Thank you once again for your dedicated service and commitment to helping those in our community.

Best regards,
Francois Menez

email_chain.subject: Energy Business Model Development
email_chain.body:
Dear Francois and Sandrine,

I wanted to bring to your attention a promising development in the energy sector. Last week marked another milestone with Apollo's acquisition of The Unical Petroleum Corporation. This is just one in a series of acquisitions by foreign firms, such as Blythe & Blythe Energy and CITGO.

America may boast the largest energy market, but as foreign investments increase, opportunities abroad are becoming more and more appealing for ventures in LNG, Biomass, Oil & Gas.

Best regards,
John R.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Shipping and Fees for Ground Nuts
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Haider,

We'll be shipping 30,000kg of ground nuts from Bonny to Monrovia. Are there any congestion issues at these ports? Could you also provide a quote for the handling and demurrage fees?

Regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping and Fees for Ground Nuts
email_chain.body:
Hi Bobby,

Bonny is currently clear for boarding. However, there's considerable berthing congestion at Monrovia. We can plan for handling and departure by next Monday. The cost breakdown is as follows:

- R/T cargo handling fee: $480/mt
- Storage and demurrage: $4,500
- Handling in Monrovia: $100/mt

This totals to $8,580. If this is acceptable, I can prepare the necessary documents and send them over to you.

Regards,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping and Fees for Ground Nuts
email_chain.body:
Hi Isaac,

Thank you for your prompt response. Yes, please prepare the documents for our approval.

Regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Documents Approval and Payment Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Isaac,

We have approved the documents. Could you please send us your bank account details so that we can proceed with the payment?

Regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for HFO Shipping from Fujairah to Dar es Salaam
email_chain.body: We need to ship 4,000MT of HFO from Fujairah to Dar es Salaam. Are you currently in the market for such operations, and could you confirm if the port dues are included in your rate? Best regards, Donald

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for HFO Shipping from Fujairah to Dar es Salaam
email_chain.body: Following up on my previous email regarding the shipment of 4,000MT of HFO from Fujairah to Dar es Salaam. We are prepared to pay $1,900/MT with CIF terms at Dar es Salaam. Please let us know your position on this offer. Best regards, Donald

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Final Follow-Up for HFO Shipment
email_chain.body: I am writing to follow-up one last time regarding our proposal to ship 4,000MT of HFO from Fujairah to Dar es Salaam with a CIF rate of $1,900/MT. It is important for us to finalize the arrangements quickly, and we would appreciate your prompt response. Best regards, Donald

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Ship Leasing Returns
email_chain.body: Good day Mr. Carter, I hope this email finds you well. Your website mentions 'great returns in ship leasing.' Could you please specify what kind of returns can be expected? Looking forward to your response. Regards, Charlie Brown.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Ship Leasing Returns
email_chain.body: Hi Charlie, Thank you for reaching out with your questions about our ship leasing business. I will be visiting your office tomorrow morning to provide more detailed information and discuss any questions you may have in person. Cheers, Jim Carter.

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Upcoming Office Visit
email_chain.body: Hello Charlie, I just wanted to send a quick reminder about my visit to your office tomorrow. I'm looking forward to discussing our ship leasing business and sharing my experiences. Feel free to prepare any questions you might have. See you soon, Jim Carter.

email_chain.subject: Capacity Inquiry for Vancouver to Yokohama Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Lee,

I'm looking for a shipping capacity of 6,800 metric tons from Vancouver to Yokohama, scheduled for March 6th. Do you have any available vessels that can accommodate this request on a suitable schedule?

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Capacity Inquiry for Vancouver to Yokohama Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jane,

Confirming availability of 6,800MT carrying capacity for delivery to Yokohama on March 6th. The vessel can depart from Vancouver at 01:00 on Wednesday. We expect it to arrive in Yokohama around 03:00 on Thursday, weather permitting.

Currently, the weather forecast around southern British Columbia shows average temperatures with moderate winds, which should not delay our schedule. However, I will keep you updated on any changes.

Best,
Lee

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Gypsum Shipment from Perth to Apia
email_chain.body:
G'day George,

We have 20,000MT of gypsum that needs to be shipped from Perth to Apia by mid-May. Could you please provide the shipping cost with your vessel? Additionally, what other materials can your vessel carry?

Cheers,
Luca

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Gypsum Shipment from Perth to Apia
email_chain.body:
Greetings Luca,

The APEC vessel can haul up to 7,000MT in the various holds and can achieve in excess of 9 knots, which is beneficial for speedy deliveries to destinations like Fiji. Please let me know if this meets your requirements and if you need rates for other destinations.

Regards,
Adrian
Mobile: +61 (0) 417 955 640
fax: +61 (0) 2 9315 8259
www.apexoffshore.com.au

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quote: Tarragona to New York
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

Could you provide a quote for a shipment of 7,600MT of granulated sugar from Tarragona to New York? Please specify if BAF (Bunker Adjustment Factor) and Port Dues are included in the rate. We plan to have the cargo delivered by the end of February 2023.

Warm regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Available Vessel Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

We have one vessel available from late March to April, traveling from Chile to Japan. The vessel's details are as follows:
- Capacity: 10,000 MT
- DWT: 43,000
- Age: 16 years
All our vessels are company-owned. Please provide your best offers.

Best Regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Sugar Shipment from Valencia to Bangkok in July
email_chain.body:
Hi Per,

Can you arrange a shipment of 15k MT of sugar from Valencia to Bangkok in early July? What are the dates for your laycan and how much is the demurrage charge?

Regards,
Yuki

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment from Valencia to Bangkok in July
email_chain.body:
Hi Yuki,

Thanks for your email. We can arrange the shipment with a laycan period from 2nd July to 15th July 2020, subject to vessel availability. Our rates are as per the attached document.

With best regards,
Q. J.

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment from Valencia to Bangkok in July
email_chain.body:
Hi Q,

Thank you for your prompt reply. If we could proceed at the FOB rate, that would be appreciated. The laycan period from 2nd July to 14th July works for us.

Many thanks,
Yuki

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment from Valencia to Bangkok in July - Vessel Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Q,

Can you let us know if you will ship using any specified vessels? If so, can we load on the same day we're given? If not, can you ship on any vessel after 2nd July?

Thanks,
Yuki

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment from Valencia to Bangkok in July - Vessel Information
email_chain.body:
Hi Yuki,

Thank you for your query. Our vessels, Zim Istanbul & Zim Santo Domingo, will be sailing by mid-July from Valencia. We can schedule the cargo on these vessels from the Port of Valencia.

With best regards,
Q. J.

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment from Valencia to Bangkok in July - Confirmation Needed
email_chain.body:
Hi Q,

Many thanks for your prompt reply. Please confirm by 30th June latest that the details are arranged as discussed.

Many thanks,
Yuki

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment from Valencia to Bangkok in July - Final Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Yuki,

Thank you for your email. We will finalize the booking details and revert by your requested date.

Best regards,
Q. J.

email_chain.subject: Request for Loading Window Dates
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. McDonough,

Could you provide the available loading window dates for 1,300MT of bagged cement from Mukah to the Azores?

Kind regards,
Eileen

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Spot Cargo for N. Chile
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Could you please provide details about the spot cargo capacity for N. Chile? We are looking at underdeck capacity of 800 cbm from Galveston, Texas with a load date between 10-12 July 2019. The line under consideration is Suezmax with an availability of 20,000 MT bulk.

Payment Terms: 75% TT, 25% L/C at sight in NY.

Thank you,
Bill

email_chain.subject: Data Analysis Request
email_chain.body:
Mr. McDonough,

Your data suggests that the cost of maritime transportation has significantly dropped over the past three years, despite the increase in bunker prices. Could you please provide a comparative analysis for two specific time periods?

Best regards,
Heather

email_chain.subject: Query about Bridge Management
email_chain.body:
On Mon, May 20, 2019 at 05:54 PM,

Why do the captain and crew occasionally leave the bridge, seemingly forgetting the wheel's location? Is this a common practice, or just typical human error? It seems crucial especially in busy harbors or channels for a person to always be at the helm.

Thank you for addressing my concerns.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Spot Cargo Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McDonough,

As I am studying for my Mate's Certificate and delving into the maritime business, I've noticed that the spot cargo rates seem exceptionally low. How is it viable to operate profitably with such rates?

Thanks,
Brendan

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Oil Discharge Capacity at Aviles
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hardman,
Do you think your vessel can discharge 3,200MT of crude oil in the Spanish port of Aviles on June 21?
Sincerely,
Elly

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Oil Discharge Capacity at Aviles
email_chain.body:
Dear Elly,
3,200 MT is a problem. How about 1,900 MT?
Yours,
Guy Hardman

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Oil Discharge Capacity at Aviles
email_chain.body:
Dear Guy,
OK. Thank you.
Elly

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Vessel Ownership
email_chain.body:
Dear Elly,
May I ask if the tanker belongs to Atlantic Petroleum? It was planned to carry a tank of African oil, it needs to be a ship from your company, with sufficient capacity. Where do you plan to disburse?
Have a good day.
Alfonso

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Vessel Ownership
email_chain.body:
Dear Alfonso,
This oil is being transported from the African port of Matadi to the South American port of San Juan de Marcona. The chartering of the vessel has been adjusted accordingly.
Best wishes,
Elly

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry: Dubai to Hodeidah
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Rodriguez,

I’d like to charter your vessel to move 6,000MT of gas oil from Dubai to Hodeidah. Please confirm your next available laycan, and could you also advise on whether you would handle the ballast leg of the trip?

Thanks,
Ana

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry: Dubai to Hodeidah
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Mahmoud,

Following up on my previous request, I’d like to confirm the chartering of your vessel to move 6,000MT of gas oil from Dubai to Hodeidah. Please confirm your next open laycan, and could you also advise on whether you handle the ballast leg of the trip?

Thanks,
Ana

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Charter Inquiry Follow-Up
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Mahmoud,

I am hoping to finalize the arrangements for chartering your vessel. Can you confirm the next open laycan for transporting 6,000MT of gas oil from Dubai to Hodeidah, and whether you handle the ballast leg of the trip?

Thanks,
Ana

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel ETA and Loading Schedule at Huizhou
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Agostino,

Could you please inform us of the ETA for the next vessel out of Huizhou and confirm how soon you can load a container of canned corned beef destined for Tanger? We appreciate your prompt response as planning depends on this information.

Thank you,
Elliot

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel ETA and Loading Schedule at Huizhou
email_chain.body:
Hi Elliot,

Thank you for your message. The vessel CNJU 0801 is currently in port and loaded with your product. It is not ready to receive any new loads at the moment. Please let us know if you would like to schedule any further bookings.

Best regards,
Joe Agostino
Voyage/Port Executive

email_chain.subject: Further Inquiry on Next Vessel Availability at Huizhou
email_chain.body:
Hi Joe,

Elliot

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Vessel Capacity and Demurrage Terms

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Vessel Capacity and Demurrage Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear Paula,

I can confirm that outturn demurrage will start at 1200hrs on the 16th of April. If the cargo is not onboarded by 1700hrs, demurrage will be assessed at a rate of $US900 per day.

Regards,
Gerry

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Vessel Capacity and Demurrage Terms

Thank you for the confirmation.

Kind regards,

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quote: Jeddah to Kaohsiung
email_chain.body: To all Freight Forwarders, can you send me a quote for 3,000MT of coal from Jeddah to Kaohsiung for shipment in early July? Thank you! Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Quote: Jeddah to Kaohsiung
email_chain.body: Dear Jason, Thank you for your email and for the opportunity to quote for this shipment of coal. Our quotation is USD260/MT CIF Kaohsiung. Can you please confirm that this price is acceptable to you? Kind regards, Greg

email_chain.subject: Revised Offer for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jason, Unfortunately, my client did not accept our initial offer. We now propose an FOB Jeddah price of USD210/MT with an additional USD20/MT as a demurrage charge at the terminal. Please let me know if this offer is acceptable or if you wish to negotiate further. Kind regards, Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Offer for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Greg, Thank you for your email. It is acceptable for our side to receive the cargo under such conditions. Thanks for your effort and cooperation, I look forward to receiving the detail. Regards, Jason

email_chain.subject: Temporary Hold on Acceptance of Terms
email_chain.body: Thank you for your offer. However, I’m afraid our client cannot accept the terms at this moment, as there are issues on the customer's end. They will be receiving other cargoes later in the week, making it impossible to provide clear instructions before Friday. Please stay in touch. Thank you and take care.

email_chain.subject: Client Response on the Revised Offer
email_chain.body: Dear Jason, I’m not available during the weekend, but I have received a positive response from my client. However, my client can confirm your offer only for 2500MT, not 3000MT. In that case, my FOB price remains USD210/MT, and the demurrage charge is USD20/MT. Please confirm this offer by the end of today. Kind regards, Greg

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Career Opportunities in Computer Engineering
email_chain.body: Dear Dr. Guest Speaker, I am writing to you because I am highly interested in computer engineering, specifically in designing advanced technology. I want to know what steps I can take to reach my goal, including potential work and learning opportunities in this field. So far, my academic journey includes a number of classes focusing on the core material necessary for a career in computer engineering. However, I am uncertain about my next step and would appreciate insights on what additional classes I should take and what organizations I might consider joining. Could you share your experiences and the steps you took to achieve your current position? Any guidance on how to navigate my career path would be immensely helpful. Thank you for your time and consideration.

email_chain.subject: Seeking Guidance on a Career in Psychology
email_chain.body: Dear Dr. Guest Speaker, My name is <NAME> and I am deeply fascinated by the field of psychology. I understand that to succeed, one must major in psychology, complete all required courses, and undertake internships among other activities. I am eager to learn from your experiences and to understand what crucial steps I should focus on to advance in this field. Could you please share your journey and any crucial advice for someone at the early stages of their career in psychology? Looking forward to your valuable insights. Thank you for your time.

email_chain.subject: Comparison and Draft Initial Letter to Career Expert
email_chain.body: Now that I have emailed Dr. Guest Speaker with inquiries about career opportunities in both computer engineering and psychology, it is crucial to compare the differences in the steps and advice needed for each field. Additionally, considering this comparison, I should draft a letter that effectively communicates my diverse interests and seeks specific advice from an industry expert. This approach may not only clarify my own path but also help garner tailored advice from someone with substantial experience.

The demurrage rate is US$250 per container, per day for both loading and discharging. Loading comes with a 30% additional charge to the standard rate. Please send your complete instructions if you'd like to proceed with chartering this vessel. Best, Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Jason, We would like to charter this vessel from Rotterdam to Long Beach, with a load of 5,000 MT. Please ensure the loading deadline is by the 30th June. We require 60 days of free time for discharge in Long Beach. Are you able to accommodate this? Regards, John Z.

email_chain.subject: Charter Party Details and Confirmation

email_chain.subject: Insurance Details and Confirmation

email_chain.subject: Re: Signed Charter Party

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Transatlantic Shipment of Maize from Puerto Rico to Malaysia
email_chain.body:
Hi Calvin,

Could you please provide me with the total cost for a transatlantic shipment of 10,000MT of maize from San Juan, Puerto Rico to Port Klang, Malaysia? Also, could you confirm whether you can obtain all the necessary documentation for this shipment?

Thanks,
Gwen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Transatlantic Shipment of Maize from Puerto Rico to Malaysia
email_chain.body:
Hello Gwen,

Thank you for reaching out with your inquiry. I am pleased to provide the following details for your shipment:

- Commodity: Maize
- Purchase Price: CIF Port Klang 
- Rate: USD 118 per MT (equivalent to MYR 4,410.00 per MT)
- Freight Cost: FCL basis at MYR 17,500.00 per 10,000 MT
- Total Cost: MYR 442,750.00 for 10,000 MT

Transport Details:
- Vessel: MV Ming Sheng Hai (Cruise 0301)
- Build Year: 2005
- IMO Number: 9301712
- Stowage Capacity: 50,000 MT

The shipment for 10,000MT is confirmed, and we can manage all required documentation on your behalf.

Best regards,
Calvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Inquiry for Isopropanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Anna,

Regarding your request, I've checked with an IPA trader here in Houston. He was surprised by the requested tonnage; typically he deals with much larger quantities, like 10,000 tonnes. However, we should still be able to arrange something for 80 tonnes.

1) For your other query: Who can prepare an ISCO from Tuxpan to Veracruz promptly?
2) And could you confirm how much per ton you're anticipating for this rate?

Thanks in advance for your responses.

Best,
Jared

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quotation

Could you please provide the following: 1. Cost per metric ton, 2. Packing details, 3. Marking specifications, 4. Shipping cost to Hong Kong based on order volume, 5. Port charges in both Thailand and Hong Kong, 6. Fees for international trade licenses, bank guarantees, insurance, and warehouse storage, 7. Any miscellaneous costs, 8. Estimated shipping duration. email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Carbon Black Purchase and Shipping Information

Our terms for providing 50 metric tons of Carbon Black, including packing and marking, shipping costs, and all other associated fees you have inquired about, are currently being prepared. We will send you a detailed proposal by tomorrow. Kind regards, [Your Name]

email_chain.subject: Request for Diesel Calculation and 24/7 Service Clarification
email_chain.body:
Good evening Mr. Menéndez,

I would like to request calculations for transporting 3,000 metric tons of diesel from Rotterdam to the 13 docks at Aarhus. Additionally, could you please confirm if your 24/7 service coverage includes all seasonal holidays?

Kind regards,
Abbie

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Diesel Calculation and 24/7 Service Clarification
email_chain.body:
Hello Abbie,

Thank you for your inquiry. Here are the details for your request:

- Assume a loading spread of 5 to 15 days. For a more conservative calculation, you might consider using 10 days.
- Guaranteed loading window is 5 days. Note that we charge 10% extra of the loading time if the barge is ready at the quay or 10% per day extra from our client’s terminal if the barge is not ready.
- Rotation time is capped at 24 hours.
- Unloading time is also limited to 24 hours.
- Total transit time is estimated at 48 hours.
- All statutory holidays are considered normal workdays for our shipping operations.
- The routing will cover Oslo, Fredericia, Middelfart, Harsholm, Portland, and Jakobsen.

Please let me know if you need any more information.

Best regards,
Mr. Menéndez

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel Recommendation
email_chain.body:

Would you be able to recommend a suitable vessel for transporting 1,300MT of nitric acid from Dalian to Antwerp, aiming for an ETA in the first week of March? Thank you in advance for your assistance.

email_chain.subject: RE: Request for Details on Latest M.B.P.
email_chain.body: Dear Neil, Thank you for your email. For us, we prefer the load ports to be either Kuwait or Jizan with a cargo size of 110-114 m3/t. Are these parameters in line with what you had in mind? It might be easier to clarify further details over the phone. Regards, Wangli

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Details on Latest M.B.P.
email_chain.body: Dear Neil, Here is the requested information. The vessel intended for the trade from Kuwait to Zhoushan is the 'Pacific Pathfinder'. Our requirements include a ship type of Aframax, and the movement will be under the charter of the China Petroleum & Chemical Corp (Sinopec Group), scheduled from 18 Dec 2016 to 05 Jan 2017. The weight handling capacity is approximately 110~114 MT/T. Should you need further details or wish to proceed with arranging the vessel, please inform us. Best regards, Fu Yong

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Transporting Polyester Material from Istanbul to Surabaya

Greetings Mr. Chen,
Our factory will be producing 8,000MT of Polyester in March, and we have a customer in Surabaya interested in purchasing this cargo. Could you advise on the availability of transport from Istanbul to Surabaya during this period and provide your FOB Surabaya freight rate?
Looking forward to your prompt response.

Elizabeta

email_chain.subject: Material (1808 MT) Available
email_chain.body:
Dear Elizabeta,
Please be informed that on March 1st, we will be unloading 1808 MT of material in Suez, including an anticipated 10% loss of weight. This cargo is currently available for sale. We have not yet confirmed the booking, but will notify you once the delivery date is finalized.
Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.
Many thanks and regards,
Anna Smith

email_chain.subject: Material Available for Sale
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,
The material is available for sale. Should you be interested in purchasing this cargo, please do not hesitate to contact me for further details and pricing.
If you have any other questions, please feel free to reach out.

Anna

Miguel

email_chain.subject: Shipping Rate Inquiry for Jet Fuel from Kaohsiung to Daesan via M&N Provider
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Regan,

Our provider M&N has quoted us a freight rate of $16.74/MT to ship jet fuel from Kaohsiung to Daesan via the motor vessel. Could you please confirm if this rate is acceptable?

Thank you,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Rate Inquiry for Jet Fuel from Kaohsiung to Daesan via M&N Provider
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

We should consider that the cost to the shipowners for bunkers is generally higher compared to what we make from selling the bunker in VETSA trades. Additionally, keep in mind that our vessel will be involved in transporting products from Daesan to India before loading jet fuel for Daesan. Therefore, the overall cost including bunker for VETSA trades would be $16.74 US/MT.

I hope this information is helpful. Let me know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Bunker Consumption Costs
email_chain.body:
Hello Eddie,

If I understand correctly, you're suggesting that an estimate of bunker consumption should be made at the load port (Daesan), reflecting usage only until the vessel arrives at the discharge port. However, it's typical practice that most of the bunker is consumed en route from load to discharge port, and payment for bunker should only cover that segment.

Does this align with our usual practices, or are there adjustments to be made?

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Tanker Analysis for Jet Fuel Route
email_chain.body:
Dave,
Please refer to the surface tanker jet fuel route chart available online and perform the necessary calculations. The route is approximately 275 miles, shortened to about 250 miles if we navigate through the shallows. With the shallowest part being 43 feet deep, a 35,000-ton tanker would require about 16 feet of water to float. An appropriate tanker traveling through this route should not significantly affect the insurance premiums, although the absence of refueling options along the route could potentially raise the rates.
Unfortunately, I couldn't locate any available tankers that meet these specs at the moment.
Best,
Bob

email_chain.subject: PDF Upload Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Al,
I have uploaded the PDF file to www.surfacetankers.info. Please check if it's accessible and fully functional.
Thanks!
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: PDF Upload Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Bob,
I searched for 'surfacetankers.info' and found 5 references. The first reference displayed the map of the Ghyben-Herzberg limited water zone, just as we needed. If you have any connections with operators of a 250K bbl tanker that wants to go to Brazil, I'm interested in discussing further. Reason being, I'd like to offload it in the Bahamas.
Best regards,
Al

a. Available delivery dates for each of the two loads, allowing 15 days for ship procurement.

Alexander

email_chain.subject: RE: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Xingxiao,

Great news, we have secured the vessels for the two 15,000MT loads and are fully booked from the load port until 2022. We’d like to offer you the low end of the range for the bunkering price. Could you please provide the revised cost?

Thanks,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: RE: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Hi Alexander,

Unfortunately, both loads are booked to August 2022. We can offer the following rate schedule:
$7.4 per metric ton on stevedore fees.
+ 4% over base rate from bunkers.
+ 3% load / discharge port fees.
We can send the commercial invoice in two weeks.

Thank you,
Xingxiao

email_chain.subject: RE: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Xingxiao,

Great! We’ll go with the $7.4 flat rate for stevedore fees.

Thanks,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Availability Next Week for Coal Transport
email_chain.body:
Hey David,

We have 6,300MT of coal to move from Hoboken to Zeebrugge. Do you have a vessel in the area next week?

Sincerely,
Kent

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability Next Week for Coal Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Kent,

Indeed, we have a ship in the area with a total volume capacity of 27,000MT available next week.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Freight Cost
email_chain.body:
Hello David,

Are you willing to move the 6,300MT from Hoboken to Zeebrugge at $10 USD per MT?

Thanks,
Kent

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for Freight Cost
email_chain.body:
Hi Kent,

$10 USD per MT is way too low. We normally move coal for $25 USD per MT. $10 USD is below market value. Please reconsider the rate.

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Acceptance of Freight Cost at $25 USD per MT
email_chain.body:
Hello David,

We agree to pay $25 USD per MT to transport the coal. Please proceed with the arrangements.

Best,
Kent

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Freight Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Hi Kent,

Thank you for your confirmation. I will coordinate the logistics and update you shortly.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Urgent Request for Mont Crispi by 9th April - USG Priority
email_chain.body:

We are in the process of loading a vessel for 15,000MT of LNG from Ibiza to Fujairah and require immediate confirmation of the availability of the MV Mont Crispi, currently positioned in the Mediterranean. We have a U.S. Government priority loading window from the 8th to the 11th of April. Please confirm the ship’s availability and its estimated time of arrival in Japan by Friday, 7th April.

Kind Regards,
Xavier

email_chain.subject: Concern Regarding Breach of Engagement Contract
email_chain.body:
Dear Xavier,

I hope this message finds you well. I need to bring to your attention a concern regarding a potential breach in our engagement contract concerning the funding partnership with Petrobras. We have not received the required proof of asset from your end. Please address this matter urgently to avoid escalation into legal actions.

Regards,
Elisabet

email_chain.subject: Transport Inquiry for Oil Palm from Tanjung Pinang to Karachi
email_chain.body: Hi Nishant, Could you handle a shipment of 6,900 MT of oil palm from Tanjung Pinang to Karachi? We're looking to secure slots in the last two weeks of August. Could you also provide your standard demurrage clause? Best, Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Inquiry for Oil Palm from Tanjung Pinang to Karachi

email_chain.subject: Charter Party Contract Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Carriage of Special Cargo

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Charter Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Potential Acquisition Inquiry
email_chain.body: Hi Rob, I've heard rumors that you are in talks to merge with Brooker Inc. Is this true? We at our company are highly interested in acquiring a broker. Having followed your success for a while, we believe you could be a great addition to our organization. Looking forward to your thoughts. Best, Jorge

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Acquisition Inquiry
email_chain.body: Hello Jorge, Thanks for your interest. I'm open to discussing potential partnerships or acquisitions. Transitioning from another firm could be a smooth process, and we can provide the necessary applications and information. Looking forward to further discussions. Regards, Rob

email_chain.subject: Completion of Brokerage Agreement
email_chain.body: Hi Rob, I will complete the brokerage agreement and send it to you in the next 3 days. We haven't yet discussed compensation, but I'm confident we'll find an agreement beneficial to both parties. Thank you for your prompt response. Best regards, Jorge

email_chain.subject: Local Market Insights
email_chain.body: Hey Rob, How familiar are you with the local market conditions in our area? We're interested in making some investments but are cautious about potential market corrections predicted soon. Can we discuss this further? Cheers, Jorge

email_chain.subject: Compensation Discussion
email_chain.body: Rob, As we move forward, it would be beneficial to discuss the compensation terms. Could you provide an idea of what terms would be reasonable? I'm eager to work out a deal that's mutually acceptable. Warm regards, Jorge

email_chain.subject: Review of Financials
email_chain.body: Dear Rob, Thank you for reevaluating the figures. I will take another look at them, though I still have some reservations about their adequacy for a solid deal. I am open to starting as a silent partner and later converting to a full acquisition as the business picks up. Meanwhile, can you provide more detailed numbers for a thorough assessment? Thanks again, Jorge

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Multiple Cargos
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Chen,

Could you advise on the freight for the following cargos?

1. 8,000MT of HFO from Dili to Sekondi, payable against B/L (FIO).
2. 7,500MT of Gasoil from Nosy Be to Tema, payable against B/L (FIO).

Your kind response would be much appreciated.

Sincerely,
George

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Multiple Cargos
email_chain.body:
Hello George,

For the cargo arrangements, you can consider:
1. One CIF option if there's direct berthing at the second port, otherwise, two CIF options apply.
2. Two FIO options, noting there is no guarantee (Consideration for a Charter Party may be advisable).

Have a good evening.

Best regards,
Larry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Additional Information
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

As additional information, Geary Tankers B.V. has limited experience with HFO cargoes. For your reference, here are some previous case examples:
- Malange to Pointe Noire: 1,500 tons HFO, CIF with double nomination in Porto Amboim, earned $34,000 with time charter at $22,000.
- For Rotterdam bookings: HFO dated 9/24/2012, 7,000 tons at USD 33.75/MT, and on 9/20/2012, 4,000 mt HFO.

If these suit your planning goals, let us know how we can assist further.

Best,
Larry

email_chain.subject: Re: Oil Contract Case Histories
email_chain.body:
Hello George,

For your reference, Geary Tankers B.V. previously handled two oil contract cases:
1. Oil delivery from Curacao to Pointe-a-Pitre in Guadeloupe.
2. Oil sale from Fort-de-France in Martinique to Pointe-a-Pitre.

The former involved 2,000 mt HFO to M/S Mayflower Bayside under CIF terms with legal complications, and delivery to a named port (Port Louis in Guadeloupe) for Epsilon Tankers Corporation.

Best regards,
Larry

labels.load_port: Dili, Nosy Be, Malange, Fort-de-France, Curacao
labels.discharge_port: Sekondi, Tema, Pointe Noire, Pointe-a-Pitre, Guadeloupe

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Shipment Details

- Unloading port: Antwerp (ATE)
- Estimated Time of Departure: 13th July 2018

Please be informed that our policy requires full vessel loading. For more information or to discuss the freight rate, please contact me on my mobile at +44 1234 567 890.

Team Logistics Department

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Iron Ore Transport from Virginia to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Jack,

I'm currently looking to secure transportation for 20,000 MT of iron ore from Virginia to Turkey. We are exploring options including after-hours berthing and are flexible with the schedule. Can you please provide me with available shipping options for next week and the upcoming month?

Thanks,
Susanna

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Follow-Up on Shipping Options to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Jack,

Just following up on my previous email as we urgently need to finalize the shipping options from Virginia to Turkey. What do you suggest for daily services starting next week?

Thanks,
Susanna

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Follow-Up on Shipping Options to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Dear Susanna,

Our liners operate out of Virginia, Houston, and Long Beach in the US, and provide services to Istanbul, İzmir, Kütahya, and Antalya in Turkey. We offer a weekly direct service from Savannah to İzmir which is quite swift, taking just about 14 days end-to-end. For shipments from Houston to Antalya, the transit is approximately 11 days. We provide services three times a week from these locations. For a detailed monthly schedule, please visit our website. Remember that we do not handle individual bookings directly; you will need to engage a freight forwarder or consolidator to manage your booking.

Best regards,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Charter: Yanbu to Karachi
email_chain.body: Could your vessel load 6,500MT of naphtha from Yanbu to Karachi next week, and what is your typical FOB price? Thanks, Beatrice

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Charter: Yanbu to Karachi
email_chain.body: Hi Beatrice, The typical FOB price would be USD 55,000. Best regards, Johannes

email_chain.subject: Export LNG to Malta
email_chain.body: We need 80,000MT of LNG (4 full tanks) to be loaded from your facility in Fujairah or Jebel Ali, with delivery to Malta around mid-August. Could you please provide your lump sum freight charges, and which vessels would be available for this shipment? Thank you, Shalini

email_chain.subject: Re: Export LNG to Malta
email_chain.body: Hello Shalini, Greetings from Wavin! Thank you for reaching out with your shipment request. I am happy to assist. Here is our proposal for the export of 80,000MT of LNG to Malta: 1. Load port: Fujairah 2. Discharge Port: Malta 3. Available Tankers: - UJINDO (flag: Marshall Islands, built 2012) - Wavin Valley (flag: Korea, renowned for its safety and quality). For more details on Wavin Valley, please visit: https://www.myshipinfo.com/ships/103516/Wavin-Valley/62621 4. Terms of payment: Invoice online. We are looking forward to begin this project. Please let me know your thoughts. Best regards

email_chain.subject: Clarification Needed on Quotation Details
email_chain.body:
Can you please confirm the following details from the current emailed quotation:
1. Number of Tanks 
2. Tank Size 
3. Total Capacity 
4. Slop Space 
5. Freight Cost 
6. Freight Time 
7. Vessel ETA 
8. Vessel ETD
Our office will be closed from Monday, 3rd April until Friday, 7th April. If you have any questions during this period, please contact me on my mobile. 
Sincerely,
Liam

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification Needed on Quotation Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Liam,
Thank you for your email. We are analyzing the details of your inquiry and will prepare a revised proposal based on the provided items. Please confirm if the information listed below is correct:
1. Number of Tanks 
2. Tank Size 
3. Total Capacity

email_chain.subject: Shipping Order Query for July - Urgent
email_chain.body: Hello Owen, Our Australian customer is planning to ship 2,500MT of powdered milk and possibly an additional 1,500MT of grain from Port Botany, Sydney to Tokyo. This shipment is scheduled for the first week of July. We need a quotation for shipping a total of 4,000MT. Could you also advise on the risk of port congestion at this time? Many thanks, Ivy

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Order Query for July - Vessel Availability
email_chain.body: Hi Ivy, Good morning. We can certainly handle the 2,500MT of powdered milk. However, fitting both cargoes in the same vessel poses a challenge due to their combined size. We have the M/V T1, a general cargo vessel flagged in Liberia (Call sign MOYO, DWT 8,600, built in 1996), which could accommodate 1,000MT of powdered milk and 1,500MT of grain. Let me know if this suits your needs. Best, Owen

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Order Query for July - Port Congestion Risks
email_chain.body: Ivy, Regarding port congestion in Australia, the situation is worsening, and slots are scarce. Railway terminals are also quite overloaded. If waiting until October is an option, it could potentially offer better conditions and rates. Let me know your thoughts. Regards, Owen

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Order for Early July
email_chain.body: Hello Owen, Thank you for the details. We need to proceed with the shipment in early July due to storage constraints and potential depreciation of goods. We also expect more orders in July needing transportation. Please assist us in finalizing the best possible plan for this timeframe. Regards, Ivy

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Order for Early July - Potential September Slots
email_chain.body: Hi Ivy, I understand your urgency and constraints. For July, we can offer a slot for 1,000MT. For August, we have two options: either 2,000MT on a 6,000dwt vessel or 3,000MT on a 6,500dwt vessel, both due in September. Please let me know your preference for the August shipment regarding cargo type. Regards, Martin

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request for Cement Transportation
email_chain.body:

Could you please confirm if your vessel can transport 1,500 bags of cement from Muuga to Petromax? We would appreciate a freight quote by the 6th of September. Additionally, could you advise on any potential extra pilotage charges?

Kind regards,
Bhanu

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request for Cement Transportation
email_chain.body:
Hi Bhanu,

Please see the attached freight estimate for transporting the cement bags.

Best regards,
Bob.

email_chain.subject: Clarification Required for Cement Bag Quantity
email_chain.body:
Dear Bhanu,

Regarding the transportation of cement, due to vessel capacity constraints, I would need to adjust the quote if transporting the full 1,500 bags. For now, my quote is based on 1,000 bags. Please confirm if this amendment is acceptable, or if alternative arrangements should be considered.

Kind regards,
Bob.

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification Required for Cement Bag Quantity
email_chain.body:
Dear Bob,

Thanks for the clarification. The quantity of 1,500 bags has not changed. Could you please re-evaluate your capacity and confirm if you can manage the original quantity? Kindly adjust your quote accordingly. Please confirm by 7th September.

Regards,
Bhanu

email_chain.subject: Request for Crude Oil Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chauhan,

We are looking to arrange a fixture for 200,000 bbl of crude oil from Sakhalin to India. Could you please share your earliest available loading window? Additionally, please let us know if you offer any dispatch incentives.

Thank you,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Crude Oil Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Maria,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can start loading the first 10,000 bbl of the cargo from Sakhalin on May 20. The subsequent loading schedule from the same terminal is as follows:
- 20,000 bbls – May 25
- 30,000 bbls – May 31
- 140,000 bbls – June 5

Our dispatch rate is 1%.

Best regards,
Dinesh
Singapore Representative
Sea King Shipping Co.

email_chain.subject: Alternative Transportation Options
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Maria,

Thank you for your email. We have just checked with another carrier at the same terminal as Sea King Shipping Co. Unfortunately, this carrier has been experiencing frequent cancellations and reschedules due to force majeure. I suggest we explore other carriers, possibly on the Japan to India route, who may offer competitive rates and more reliable service. We will do our best to ensure timely delivery of your cargo.

Thanks,
Aniruddha Roy

email_chain.subject: Contract Cancellation Notification
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Aniruddha Roy,

Please be informed that due to recent global economic challenges leading to multiple strikes, we intend to cancel our contract with your firm.

Sincerely,
Catherine Whipple
Manager of E-Trading
Ocean Network Express Pte. Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Response to Contract Cancellation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Maria,

We are sorry to hear about your decision to cancel the contract. However, our terms clearly state we are not responsible for delays in delivery. If you believe we have breached the contract, please respond with the specific remedy you seek.

Yours sincerely,
Sea King Shipping Co.

email_chain.subject: Enquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body: We are considering a large cargo of 1,000,000MT of coal from Barry to Alexandria. Could you advise on any suitable open charters for this shipment? Sincerely, George

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Hello George,

Thank you for reaching out. To assist you effectively, could you specify the type of coal (e.g., NSC, ARA) and the specific port of loading in Barry (e.g., BPT, UKCOAL)?

It would be best to proceed with a time charter given the market conditions. Ship specifications are generally a constraint, but I will look into available vessels and provide you with a cost estimate.

Feel free to contact me for any further information, and I'll be glad to assist.

Kind regards,
Noah
Cape Shipping Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Shipping Methods for Rubber from Shanghai to Salem
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ghosh,

My group is currently looking to source 25,000MT of rubber from Shanghai to Salem. We are quite flexible on the loading schedule but are exploring two possible shipping methods:
1. A 50/50 split shipment via Hoegh Autoliner 85 and Maersk Ode. Could you please provide how much extra this option would cost compared to a typical voyage at your current market rate?
2. A 33/67 split shipment via Golden Highway and Damleev. Can we avail any discount if we opt for this for 2016 as well?

Looking forward to your guidance.

Sincerely,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Methods for Rubber from Shanghai to Salem
email_chain.body:
Dear Sarah,

Thank you for your inquiry. I have forwarded your request to our China department for detailed advice as it pertains to the use of Hoegh Autoliner 85 and Maersk Ode, as I recently handled a similar query for another client. As for the sea transport to India, although it's not my direct area, I would recommend considering the Hoegh Autoliner for competitive rates.

I shall update you once I receive a response from our China department. Feel free to reach out with any additional queries in the meantime.

Have a great day!
Yours faithfully,
Rita Lee

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Methods for Rubber from Shanghai to Salem
email_chain.body:
Dear Rita,

I received your message and appreciate the update on Hoegh Autoliner 85 and Maersk Ode. Could you also let me know the anticipated timing for this service? Additionally, should I also consider the Golden Highway and Damleev routes for both 2015 and 2016, given that the volume requirements would remain the same for both years?

Thanks,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Crude Availability from Cepu

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Crude Availability from Cepu

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Crude Availability from Cepu

email_chain.subject: Product Specifications
email_chain.body: Mr. John, We can supply crude oil with API 23.7 and sulfur content of 0.36%. Regards, Miss Nguyen

email_chain.subject: Confidentiality Agreement and Shipping Query
email_chain.body: Miss Nguyen, Can you ship out under a confidentiality agreement? This is crucial for our procurement process. Regards, Mr. John

email_chain.subject: Request for Pricing Details
email_chain.body: Dear Miss Nguyen, We are also interested in purchasing at least 50,000 MT of crude oil from Cepu. Could you please advise on your selling price? Regards, Mrs. Smith

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Supply Capability
email_chain.body: Hi Mr. John, I have confirmed that we are able to supply up to 100,000 MT of crude oil from Cepu. Can you confirm the quantity you need so we may proceed with the formal agreement? Regards, Miss Nguyen

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Shipping 2000MT of Tobacco from Haldia to Belgium
email_chain.body: Howdy, Kelly! Is your vessel currently available to transport 2,000MT of tobacco from Haldia to Belgium around late September or early October? Also, could you please provide the rates for detention and demurrage in Haldia and Belgium? Best regards, Arthur.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping 2000MT of Tobacco from Haldia to Belgium
email_chain.body: Hi Arthur, Thanks for reaching out. Unfortunately, as per company policy, I am unable to book vessels directly for you. I recommend contacting our chartering department directly to assist you further. Looking forward to meeting you soon at our home port. Cheers, Kelly.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping 2000MT of Tobacco from Haldia to Belgium
email_chain.body: Arthur, I would really appreciate if you could provide me with the email address of your counterparty as mentioned in your initial email, and forward this to your accounts team to negotiate further on the same. Thanks and warm regards, Kelly.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping 2000MT of Tobacco from Haldia to Belgium
email_chain.body: Hello Arthur, I hope this finds you well. Unfortunately, I must insist that I cannot provide the email address of our chartering department. Please approach them through official channels or engage a genuine agent to represent your interests. My apologies for any inconvenience. Warm regards, Kelly.

email_chain.subject: Final Notice: Re: Inquiry for Shipping 2000MT of Tobacco from Haldia to Belgium
email_chain.body: Arthur, I understand your position but it's important to follow protocol, so I cannot be blamed for corporate policy. If we are unable to meet in person, please do forward your concerns via an official email to our company, and they will handle it from there. Thank you for your understanding. Warm regards, Kelly.
