- Quantity
- Payment Terms
- Export License
- Delivery time

Thanks,
Ting

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Rubber Shipment from Guangzhou to Manila
email_chain.body:
Dear Ting,

Here are the shipment details:
- From: Guangzhou, China
- Destination: Manila, Philippines
- Quantity: 2,000MT (approximately 28,000 boxes, Gross 1000@1.2Tons)
- Payment Terms: The exporter shall arrange a Bank Letter of Credit to the order of Kimono Inc. (Korean Export Company). Cash / Bank Cashier Check in US Dollars at 60% of the value in the Letter of Credit. The balance shall be paid in cash upon confirmation of inspection results at origin.
- Export License: Appropriate customs and commercial licenses
- Delivery Time: By sea, with 21 days ex-work, 15-30 days by air, as per agreement.

Sincerely yours,
Drew Wong

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Rubber Shipment from Guangzhou to Manila
email_chain.body:
Dear Drew,

Thank you for providing the shipment details. Here are our terms:
1. Your company shall provide a Letter of Credit in favor of Hapag-Lloyd.
2. You will be responsible for all taxes/duties and all associated costs including local, state, and federal.
3. Your company will bear the cost of the shipment including the cost of packing and insurance.
4. The cost of the shipment shall be paid on the 10th day of the last month of every quarter.
5. The shipping schedule shall be agreed upon between your company and Hapag-Lloyd.
6. The shipment shall be delivered 30 days after the shipment date.

Best regards,
Ting

P.S. 1000 Box is 2500.00 per ton.
28,000 Box = 70,000

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Import Restrictions for Pine Lumber

email_chain.subject: Alternative Solutions for Lumber Shipment
email_chain.body: Following up on our earlier email, there is an alternative approach. Your business could certify compliance with the import regulations without explicit inspection from U.S. authorities, though it requires careful documentation. Common issues arise in distinguishing between logs and processed lumber. Even a commitment to pay for a formal inspection might not suffice to clear U.S. Customs without such certificates. An import or export certificate issued by the country of origin could be a viable way to demonstrate legal compliance. Let me know if you would like more details on this approach. Best, Lyle

Additionally, we plan to charter more vessels for shorter routes, lasting 1-2 weeks each under the same freight terms. We aim to secure these charters in June and July. email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

Thank you for your inquiry. The CIF rate is USD 28.58/MT plus a premium of USD 0.28/MT pegged to the ASP/ICE Brent index. Could you please provide further details such as your company name, the specific port of discharge, vessel size, and the exact size of cargo for which you are looking to book space? This information will help us to provide you with further details.

Warm Regards,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for CIF Rate from Black Sea to Thailand
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Adam,

Thank you for the prompt reply. We are considering the rate you provided. Could you confirm if the rate includes or excludes the aforementioned premium of USD 0.28/MT?

Warm Regards,
Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for CIF Rate from Black Sea to Thailand
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

The CIF rate of USD 28.58/MT is exclusive of the USD 0.28/MT premium linked to the ASP/ICE Brent index. Please do not hesitate to provide your company's details, discharge port, vessel size, and cargo size, so we can proceed with a formal offer.

Warm Regards,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Fernandez,

Can your vessel load 9,000MT of fertilizer from Yanbu to Long Beach? Kindly also advise what documentation is required and any terms & conditions attached.

Looking forward to hearing from you,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Hi Nigel,

Thank you for your inquiry.

Please take note that we do not provide chartering services. I would highly suggest arranging a visit with your colleagues to our yard so we could better explain the scale of our operation.

Please let us know if we can assist you in any other way.

Kind regards,
Kerwin

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Hi Kerwin,

Sorry for the delay in replying. Kindly find our client's details attached along with our Terms & Conditions for bulk cargoes.

We are looking forward to our cooperation.

Many thanks and best regards,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: Clarification Needed on Yard Capabilities
email_chain.body:
Hi Kerwin,

Thank you for your previous emails. However, could you kindly clarify if your yard can handle a vessel of the size: 300m x 36m x 13m deep? Additionally, please advise:
1. The soil forking reach to the yard (from the berth)?
2. How deep your yard is?
3. The dimensions of your yard?

Looking forward to your response.

Best,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: RE: Clarification Needed on Yard Capabilities
email_chain.body:
Hi Nigel,

Sorry for the delay in replying. Kindly find attached the vessel specifications and yard drawings as requested. Our yard has a soil forking reach of 38m from the berth and we have 5.8m draught available inside our dock. The dimensions of our dock are 320m length by 30m width.

Please let me know if you have any other questions.

Regards,
Kerwin

email_chain.subject: Request for Crude Oil Transport Quotation
email_chain.body:
To Whom It May Concern,

I require a tanker to transport 4,000MT of crude oil from Saudi Arabia to Oman. Could you provide your best rate, and what does your typical laytime policy look like?

Sincerely,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Crude Oil Transport Quotation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

I can accommodate your shipment in my tanker at a freight rate of $15 per MT. The laytime policy for oil tanker shipments is generally a maximum of 14 days, but I would like to clarify the details of the shipment and payment to schedule the loading and confirmation of laytime. Please revert to me.

With regards,
Zachary

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Crude Oil Transport Quotation
email_chain.body:
Dear Zachary,

I hope this message finds you well. Regarding the shipment, here are the details:

- Destination: Shallow seaport in Oman
- Volume: 4,000MT
- Delivery: January 15-30

The freight rate of $15 per MT sounds good, and I agree to confirm the details of the shipment and payment as well.

Sincerely,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Payment Confirmation for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Zachary,

Regarding your message, I would like to confirm the payment for the shipment as well. Please let me know the total amount and the payment method so we can finalize the details. Thank you.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Payment Confirmation for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mike,

Here's the calculation. The total cost for the shipment is $60,000. The payment method is 50% in advance and 50% after the completion of the shipment.

Please confirm, and let's proceed with the necessary paperwork.

Regards,
Zachary

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Import Restrictions
email_chain.body: Can you advise on the import restrictions for electronics and medical products into Canada? Thanks, Janet

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry on Import Restrictions
email_chain.body: Thank you for your inquiry. We need to do some independent research to provide you with information about import restrictions for electronics and medical products into Canada. We will get back to you with detailed information shortly.

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Shipment Delay
email_chain.body: Mike! Apologies for my late reply; I was away on business. Your shipment has been at our receiving bay since last Monday. I was informed that some pallets are not packed properly and others are too heavy. Urgent action is needed. Regards, Roger Green

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Shipping Proposal
email_chain.body: Dear Logistics Company, I have reviewed your shipping proposal. Please confirm the following: a) Your company will handle the pickup, packing, and consolidation at no extra cost. b) There is an additional charge of $350 upon reaching the Port of Entry. Awaiting your confirmation. Best, Adam Peterson

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Transit Times
email_chain.body: Good morning Brian, Thank you for the proposal. Could you please clarify if there are specific dates by which the container should be at the destination port as per your stated average transit times? I have attached questions regarding this matter to Mr. Blanchard for your review. Sincerely, Kaylene Smith

email_chain.subject: Transport request for ocean containers from Santos to Panama City
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Quispe,

I have just placed an order for two larger 20-foot ocean containers from Santos to Panama City. Could you please let me know when we can arrange a vessel for my cargo?

Thank you,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport request for ocean containers from Santos to Panama City
email_chain.body:
Hello Mark,

Upon reviewing the Ocean Atlas, I found that there are three available departures in September from Santos to Panama City. The vessel Paul Kruger will be available this month and can accommodate your cargo. I will forward a tentative booking for the Paul Kruger including all necessary details for your review.

Warm regards,
Sven

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote to Singapore
email_chain.body:
James,

We are looking to ship about 1000 cubic meters of 3-tonne cardboard boxes to Singapore. Can you provide me with a quote for shipping and inform us of the procedures upon arrival?

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote to Singapore
email_chain.body:
John,

Could you specify the dimensions and type of the cardboard boxes? Additionally, please confirm that the boxes are empty and the precise weight and volume.

Thanks,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote to Singapore
email_chain.body:
James,

They are standard kraft cardboard boxes with side flaps and are currently empty. We need to ship a total volume of 1000 cubic meters weighing 3 tonnes.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote to Singapore
email_chain.body:
John,

The price will depend on the container size you need. I would need to calculate the space utilized and the additional costs of securing the cargo. Could you tell me your preferences regarding the container dimensions?

Thanks,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote to Singapore
email_chain.body:
James,

Thanks for the update. Could you send me a list of available container sizes along with their maximum weight and volume capacities? This would help me decide the most suitable option.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote to Singapore
email_chain.body:
John,

For your cargo, you might consider using the 20-foot containers, each can handle up to 5 tonnes. We can discuss further if this option suits your needs.

Best,
James

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Payment Reminder for 4,000MT Sulphate Pulp
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

I am still awaiting payment for the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp that your company purchased from us back in March. Could you please confirm when you are expecting to pay?

Kindest Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Second Notice: Immediate Payment Required
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

As previously communicated, we are still awaiting the payment for the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp you purchased from us back in March. I must insist that this delay in payment is resolved immediately. If we do not receive payment within the next 7 days, we will have no choice but to escalate this matter to our legal team.

I hope to resolve this amicably and soon.

Kind Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Final Notice: Legal Action Pending
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

Despite multiple reminders, your company has failed to settle the payment for the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp purchased in March last year. This has forced us to refer the matter to our solicitors. This is the final communication before legal action is taken, and I urge you to take this situation very seriously.

Kind Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about freight cost and schedule for flour shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rogers,

Could you please provide the estimated freight cost for shipping 4,000MT of flour from London to Philadelphia? Additionally, could you inform me of the earliest possible date for the cargo to be scheduled? Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,
Matt Murphy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about freight cost and schedule for flour shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Murphy,

Hi Matt, the freight cost will be approximately USD 4,000 per MT. The earliest availability for the shipment is on the 2nd of next month, which falls on 15th April 2015. Do you require any additional information or further assistance?

Yours sincerely,
Tom Rogers

email_chain.subject: Request for Transport Services – Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Mohamed,

I hope this message finds you well. It’s been almost a month since our last communication. I am currently seeking assistance in securing a tanker capable of handling a shipment of methanol from South Korea to New Zealand. The required cargo size is approximately 8,000 dwt, intended for loading between mid to late May. Please let me know if you require additional details or if I should forward further documentation.

Warm regards,
Brad Thompson

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Transport Services – Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Thompson,

Thank you for reaching out. We appreciate your consideration of our trading network for your logistics needs from South Korea to New Zealand. At this moment, we are prepared to assist you with your methanol shipment. Before proceeding, could you please confirm that there are no conflicting interests that may affect our collaboration? I am happy to provide any further information or clarify any details you might need.

Best regards,
Khadija Mohamed

email_chain.subject: Compliance and Verification Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Khadija,

Your recent correspondence was forwarded to me as part of a routine compliance check. Before we can continue, could you kindly confirm whether the details of your request have been shared with other service providers? Please be aware that our company adheres to strict regulatory standards, and it has come to our attention that there might be concerns related to compliance with legal norms in your operations. We are currently verifying these details and would appreciate your cooperation in this matter. It is essential for us to ensure all engagements strictly follow legal and ethical guidelines.

Best regards,
Alice Johnson

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about the Sines to Houston Route via Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

Your BECS rate is quite competitive for a trip from Sines to Houston via Rotterdam. Can we discuss adding this route to our booking schedule and what terms you can offer?

Best,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on BECS Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

Sorry for the delay. After conducting an interview with a seafarer, I wanted to follow up about the BECS rate for our discussed route. Could you please confirm the final quote you can offer for this shipment?

Thank you,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Discrepancy in BECS Charges - Urgent Clarification Needed
email_chain.body:
Dear Anne,

I have received the bill for both fuel and BECS from my employers. It appears there is a discrepancy showing I am personally charged 2600 euros while my employer's contribution is reflected as 6500 euros, totaling $7000. Can we look into this and find a possible reconciliation?

Regards,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Inquiry for LNG Shipment in July
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Parkin,

Can you please provide a freight estimate for 6,000MT of LNG from Mopan in the US Gulf to Antwerp in July? Is port rotation compulsory for this service?

Kind Regards,
Cassie Manwell

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Inquiry for LNG Shipment in July
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Manwell,

Thank you for your enquiry. We have provided you a proposal for the movement of 6,000MT of LNG from the US Gulf to Antwerp in July. The price for this cargo is based on a fixed FOB rate. We can also offer this cargo with FCN, calculated at a CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM based on the declared volume. Both scenarios have a fixed CIF rate, with cargo delivered to the discharge port the same day. Port rotation can be arranged at the shipper's request, subject to agreement from all parties involved.

Please review the proposal and revert with your acceptance or discussion about the commercial terms (C/P or C&F).

Best regards,
James Parkin

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Concerning GCM/Voyage Charterparty Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dalschaert,

With reference to our recent e-mail communication, I am writing to inform you that our chartering division has raised an inquiry concerning the provisions of the GCM/Voyage charterparty as drafted by BIMCO, specifically about the CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM for a FCN charter. Our client, Shell, will not proceed with this arrangement unless the CBM charge for their LNG shipments is amended to less than $0.90 CBM. We are requesting an amendment in the wording of this provision from BIMCO.

Kind regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Proposed Amendment to GCM/Voyage Charterparty
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dalschaert,

Following our previous communications, please find attached a proposed amendment to the GCM/Voyage Charterparty that BIMCO is considering. The amendment is as follows:

'18.30.1 Freight shall be calculated at $1.20 per CBM based on the CBM declared by the cargo'

This would be effective for cargoes delivered after January 1, 2003. Please let us know if this amendment is agreeable, and we will proceed with BIMCO.

Many thanks,
David

email_chain.subject: Available adhesives space? Antwerp to Liverpool.
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Olsen,

Could you handle a 2,600MT cargo of adhesives from Antwerp to Liverpool before month’s end? Also, can you provide your typical demurrage and dispatch rates?

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Available bitumen space? Yanbu to Jeddah.
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Dorsey,

Got a question: any chance you have space this week for 4,800MT of bitumen from Yanbu to Jeddah? Please let me know if demurrage might be an issue.

Cheers,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about nylon transportation from Kaohsiung to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Olsen,

One of our greatest challenges in the ocean freight market is finding reliable shipping capacity. With this in mind, I'm seeking your assistance for available space to transport 3,200MT of nylon from Kaohsiung to Qingdao in the coming weeks. Please let me know your pricing and booking terms, along with ports of acceptance, and your demurrage and dispatch rates in case of any delays.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Availability and Shipping of Petcoke to Port Elizabeth
email_chain.body:
Greetings Mrs. Bird,

We are awaiting tenders for an 8,000MT cargo of dry petcoke destined for Port Elizabeth. There is some uncertainty about whether the US Gulf can provide sufficient tonnage to meet our requirements. Could you please provide estimates of available tonnages, and suggest any other competitive points of origin?

Kind regards,
Lewis

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Availability and Shipping of Petcoke to Port Elizabeth
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

The M/V Ostende is scheduled to load a cargo of Petcoke from Grays Harbor in early November. Currently, the US Gulf is the only origin from which we can supply large volumes. We anticipate having enough petcoke to meet our charterers' requirements. Please ensure to submit your documentary requirements including full sets of Bills of Lading, Charter Party, LPA Form 1, and the most recent IOPPCA for booking approval. We supply three grades of petcoke: fine, coarse, and lamellar (wax contaminated), available on an as-available basis.

We will update our webpage soon with the latest information.

Best regards,
Mrs. Bird

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Inquiry for Shipments to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ho,

Could you kindly provide us with detailed freight rates for the following cargoes to China?
- S/2106: 60,000MT LDPR 18-20%CL, ranging from 42,000 – 56,000
- CHEMICALS S/2196: 6,000MT N-HEXANE

Thank you for your attention.

Yours faithfully,

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Pricing Sources for Dry Bulk Ship Broking Data
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tompkins,

These are some of the best pricing sources for dry bulk ship broking data. I am unable to assist with specific brokerage inquiries at this time.

Best regards,

email_chain.subject: Availability and Pricing for Dry Petcoke in November and December
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Shan,

We will have dry petcoke available for November and December loading, with quantities ranging from 10,000-15,000MT per load. Please advise the price including the cost index.

Kind regards,

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Confirmation Needed for PVC Shipment to Manila
email_chain.body: Dear Luca, Could you please confirm whether our 8,600MT shipment of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) to Manila can be delivered on time? We need to know if there's space available on your vessel this week and how quickly the freight rate can be confirmed. Thank you, Simon

email_chain.subject: Revised Request and Freight Terms Clarification
email_chain.body: Hi Luca, You previously sent me a confirmation, but it was cancelled after we revised the request for a freight quote for 1,650,000ft², requiring 100% ullage. We also need the customs duties and transportation costs to Sofia to be covered by the consignee. If you confirm the space, please note that the cargo will be shipped under Free on Board (FOB) terms, with clearance cost and custom duties being the shipper’s responsibility. Please advise on the next steps. Kind regards, Alex

email_chain.subject: Shipping Agreement Update and Booking Confirmation
email_chain.body: Hi Luca, I’m pleased to inform you that we've negotiated the entire shipment with our supplier for 14,400 USD. This is great news! Can you please confirm our booking at your earliest convenience? Regards, Alex

email_chain.subject: Awaiting Response on Shipment Booking
email_chain.body: Hi Luca, Just a reminder that we are still awaiting your confirmation on our booking. It’s crucial for our planning to get a response soon. Best regards, Alex

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation Documents
email_chain.body: Dear Luca, I am now overseeing the quotation process and would like to know when you will be sending us the official quotation documents that we've discussed. Kind Regards, James

email_chain.subject: Discrepancy in Coal Shipment Invoice
email_chain.body:
Dear Hanz,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to address an issue regarding our recent transaction. The coal shipment from last month was expected to be 15,000MT as per our agreement. However, the final invoice we received indicates a shipment of 30,000MT. Could you please review this discrepancy and provide us with a corrected invoice at your earliest convenience?

Yours Sincerely,
Simplice

email_chain.subject: Re: Discrepancy in Coal Shipment Invoice
email_chain.body:
Dear Simplice,

Thank you for your email and for bringing this matter to my attention. I understand your concerns about the invoice discrepancy. This appears to be an error, and I assure you that I will personally investigate this matter. We expect to resolve this issue and send you a revised invoice within the next two weeks.

Yours Sincerely,
Hanz

email_chain.subject: Request for Change in Discharge Port and Related Estimate
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria,

We have 24,100MT of coal ready in Pulau Belawan originally bound for Kuantan. Is it possible to reroute this shipment to Muara Berau instead? Please provide an updated estimate for the delivery date and any draft limitations that may apply.

Best regards,
Makara

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Change in Discharge Port and Related Estimate
email_chain.body:
Dear Makara,

Thank you for your email. I am currently checking the availability of tugboats in Kuantan and exploring the feasibility of redirecting the cargo to Muara Berau. I will confirm with you as soon as I have further information.

Thanks,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Update on Tugboat Availability at Muara Berau
email_chain.body:
Dear Makara,

Thank you for your enquiry. Unfortunately, we cannot guarantee the availability of tugboats at Muara Berau due to limited resources. However, our vessel is currently en route from Muara Berau towards Pulau Belawan and we estimate its arrival back at Muara Berau on May 13. We will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates on tugboat availability as soon as possible.

Kind regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Alternative Tugboat Service Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Makara,

There are no vessels immediately available at Muara Berau for the next few days. To minimize your waiting time, we have identified a tugboat service company near Jakarta, approximately 12 hours from Muara Berau. Their rates are higher than our usual services but they can guarantee availability within 48 hours. Would you like us to proceed with this option? Please confirm your decision.

Thank you,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Request for Diesel Transportation from Panama to Nantes
email_chain.body:
Hello Tom,
Could we arrange the transportation of 40,000MT of diesel from Panama to Nantes next week?
Kind regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Missing Delivery Documents and Payment Issue
email_chain.body:
Hi Tomas,
I recently found out that there are some missing delivery documents which could potentially impact payment processing. It appears there might also be concerns regarding lost documents. Have you been able to locate those?
Thanks for looking into this.
Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: URGENT: Document and Payment Issue
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Tom,
I apologize for the late response. I'm having difficulties with understanding the email I received about the missing documents, and the pending payment issue. Could you assist by clarifying these matters?
Best regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Clarification Needed on Interpretation
email_chain.body:
Tom,
Can you help me verify the content of this prior communication? The email emphasizes the document issues, but there’s also mention of financial implications which I’m unsure of. Could you please review and analyze it?
Thank you,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Analysis Results
email_chain.body:
Dear Tomas,
The analysis indicates that the main issue revolves around the missing documents rather than a direct financial loss; however, this could indirectly affect financial matters if unresolved. I suggest prompt follow-up on retrieving or re-issuing those documents to mitigate any risks.
Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Assistance Required with Document Retrieval
email_chain.body:
I am still trying to ensure that the documents are not permanently lost. The manager is quite upset about the situation. I would appreciate any support on how to proceed as he seems reluctant to assist further. What should I do?
Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Assistance Required with Document Retrieval
email_chain.body:
Dear Tomas,
The issue with the documents has been noted, and I will assist you. Please coordinate with the concerned department to rectify this matter as it was not your mistake.
Best regards,
[Manager’s Name]

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request for Barley Shipment from South Africa to India
email_chain.body: Hello Mr. Nudell, My company is interested in booking a vessel to transport 15,000 metric tonnes (MT) of barley from South Africa to India. We have contacted the cargo port today and they have confirmed a loading window from August 10th to August 15th. Could you please provide us with a detailed freight quote under FOB terms and let us know your available window? Many thanks, Sasa

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About FOB Shipment from South Africa to China for Soya Cake
email_chain.body: Good day! I would like to inquire whether you can arrange an FOB shipment from South Africa to China involving 13,500MT of Soya cake. Could you please fit your costs within the range of $310 to $330 per MT, with an agency fee of $220 to $250 and an insurance cost of $0.60 per MT? I look forward to your reply. Regards, 042

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel Booking
email_chain.body: Dear Claire, We are looking to transport a large shipment of iron ore from Port Hedland to Shanghai. We are aiming for a cargo size of approximately 75,000 MT. Could you provide us with potential vessel options and a preliminary freight quote? Best, Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Booking
email_chain.body: Hello Jack, Thank you for your inquiry. We have available a Capesize vessel that perfectly fits your requirements. The starting freight quote for this route is approximately USD 22 per ton. Please confirm if this meets your expectations so we can proceed. Regards, Claire

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Booking
email_chain.body: Hi Claire, The quote seems reasonable. However, could you provide details on the vessel’s dwt and loa? Also, what would be the laytime terms? Thanks, Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Booking
email_chain.body: Hi Jack, The vessel’s dwt is about 180,000 MT and the loa is 290 meters. The laytime will start on September 5th and must be completed by September 15th. Demurrage rates apply at USD 12,000 per day beyond this. Please let me know if this works for you. Best, Claire

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Booking
email_chain.body: Hi Claire, Everything looks good. Please go ahead and finalize the booking for that Capesize vessel. Thank you for all the details. Best regards, Jack

email_chain.subject: Future Collaboration
email_chain.body:
Hello Jorge,

I hope you and your family are doing well. It has been a pleasure working with you over the last couple of years, and I am sure that others share this sentiment. Currently, our companies are undergoing merger and alignment discussions, which regrettably might affect our continued collaborations. Wishing you all the best during these changes.

Best wishes,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Seeking Guidance in Times of Change
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Munoz,

I hope this message finds you well. I believe we met briefly at the last GM Conference but have not had the opportunity to speak since. I am reaching out amidst a crucial time at our company, as our CEO, Mr. Smith, has announced his departure, presumably for a position at JPS. This news has negatively impacted our market presence, with our stock value decreasing by 8% on the day of the announcement. We are planning to appoint an interim CEO while conducting a thorough search for a permanent successor. This isn't an ideal time for such a transition, but circumstances have forced our hand.

I would greatly appreciate your advice on how to navigate this challenging period.

Best regards,
Jeff

email_chain.subject: Market Insights Needed
email_chain.body: Hi Paul, I heard that our competitors are planning to ship 9k refined oil from Hamburg to Singapore. Do you have any insights on their fixing level? Regards, Claudio

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Insights Needed
email_chain.body: Dear Claudio, Based on my previous experiences with them in Germany, they usually fix their prices at USD 30 above the market. However, they are known to be quite difficult to negotiate with. Regards, Paul

email_chain.subject: Further Details for February?
email_chain.body: Claudio, Do you have any updates on their plans for February? They are asking for USD 30/barrel above market price for January shipments. Regards, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Further Details for February?
email_chain.body: Hi John, Yes, they are planning to continue with their own price fixing for the foreseeable future. Regards, Claudio

email_chain.subject: Additional Insights
email_chain.body: That's interesting. Could you elaborate more on what differentiates them from other market players?

email_chain.subject: Re: Additional Insights
email_chain.body: Certainly, John. Their approach is quite different; they are more conservative in their operations and strive for higher margins, unlike others who might accept lower profitability.

email_chain.subject: A Sample Shipping Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello,

I am reaching out to inquire about the availability and pricing of your products for an upcoming shipment. Looking forward to your reply.

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: A Sample Shipping Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email. We will be able to dispatch the products as soon as they are back in stock. As previously mentioned, we are currently waiting for our inventory to be replenished.

Regarding the prices, the Odrive 32-32-32 is available for $155 and the PIC32 Starter Kit from Digilent is priced at $66.29.

Best regards,

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Vessel Capacity and ETA at Fujairah
email_chain.body: Dear Dr. Armaud, Can your vessel accommodate a lift of 27,000MT of coal? Also, could you please advise the next ETA of your vessel at Fujairah? Regards, Ruby

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Vessel Capacity and ETA at Fujairah
email_chain.body: Dear Ruby, Thank you for your inquiry. Yes, our vessel can handle 27,000MT of coal. The next ETA for our vessel at Fujairah is 24 Mar 2015. Best regards, Dr. Armaud

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Vessel's Schedule at Fujairah
email_chain.body: Dear Dr. Armaud, Could you please confirm if your vessel will indeed be arriving at Fujairah on 24 Mar 2015? Best regards, Yang Jianbin Sales Support

email_chain.subject: Welcome to Hopa Freight!
email_chain.body:
Dear Monica Zhang,

This message is to confirm your subscription settings and to welcome you to Hopa Freight, part of the Shipyaari Group. You are now pre-screened and recognized as a valuable potential client in the freight market.

In our FAQ section, accessible via our website, you can find information about what to expect when booking with us alongside our unique freight buying model.

Should you wish to update your details, review our privacy policy, or unsubscribe from our email list, please use the links provided in your welcome package.

Thank you and welcome aboard!

Best regards,

Customer Service Team
Hopa Freight

email_chain.subject: Broker Agreement and Next Steps
email_chain.body:
Dear Monica Zhang,

Thank you for your interest in our services. Attached to this email, you will find our Broker Agreement. Should you agree with the terms of service, please sign and return it to us via email.

Given your interest in exporting freight to China, we will assign a broker to your case as soon as we receive the signed agreement. We are based in Europe and, aside from handling freight to other European destinations, we can cater to a variety of international transport needs through our extensive network of agents.

I look forward to a fruitful collaboration.

Cheers,

Phil McBride
Hopa Freight

email_chain.subject: Request for Diesel Shipping Quote from Singapore to Georgia
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Sterling,

Could you provide a quote for shipping 13,000MT of diesel from Singapore to Savannah, Georgia? Also, I would like to know if you typically offer any free discharge time?

Thanks,
Ben

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Diesel Shipping Quote from Singapore to Georgia
email_chain.body:
Hi Ben,

Could you please confirm the following details to provide an accurate quote?

1. Is the 13,000MT ready to ship as one lot or in smaller installments?
2. What type of vessel will you be using for the shipment?
3. What is the size of each shipment?
4. Is this a one-time shipment or ongoing?
5. Is this arrangement on a contract basis or a spot charter?
6. Will the cargo be shipped in drums or bulk?
7. Are you paying via Letter of Credit (L/C) or cash?
8. Would you prefer Cost & Freight (C&F) or Free On Board (FOB) rates?
9. What is the earliest shipment date?
10. Do you require a freight guarantee or a bank guarantee? If a bank guarantee, what type?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Sterling

email_chain.subject: Re: Re: Request for Diesel Shipping Quote from Singapore to Georgia
email_chain.body:
Hi Sterling,

Thank you for your questions. Here are the details:
1. I can ship between 8,000 and 12,000 MT immediately, and 13,000MT within the next 3 weeks.
2. The vessel type is a 75,000 MT T1 Double Hull Tanker.
3. Each shipment will range from 8,000 to 12,000MT.
4. The shipments are continuous, with one trip at a time under a contractual agreement.

Best,
Ben

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Car Transportation from Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Wong,

Our client, Automaker XYZ, is exploring the possibility of using the port of Gioia Tauro to manage the logistics of shipping their Toyota Camry cars from Jakarta to Italy. Could you share if you have prior experience in transporting vehicles, specifically from Jakarta?

Best regards,
Davina

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Car Transportation from Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Dear Davina,

Thank you for reaching out. We have over ten years of experience in shipping cars from Jakarta to Italy, predominantly to the port of Gioia Tauro. Our recent contract for this route has just concluded, and we are open to new opportunities. We typically handle the transport of approximately 250 cars annually via sea, using specialized carriers from Jakarta to Genoa, followed by rail transport to Gioia Tauro.

We are keen to further discuss how we can assist Automaker XYZ and look forward to your favorable response.

Best regards,
Massimo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Car Transportation from Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Dear Massimo,

I must say we are impressed with the quality of service your company offers. Though not the largest fleet in the market, we recognize that smaller operators often deliver superior quality. We are enthusiastic about the prospect of working together and hopeful to establish a long-term partnership.

Warm regards,
Davina

email_chain.body:
Hello Alex,

Thank you for your offer. Could we have a formal charter party agreement in place by this Friday? Additionally, we need to finalize cargo operations by next Tuesday. I was also able to secure various other shipments: 20,000MT of methanol from Jubail, 3,500MT of jatoba planned for delivery by June 7th, and 5,000MT of caustic soda expected by May 23rd.

However, for this charter, I can only commit to 7,000MT and propose a one-year agreement with a 60% hold option. Also, please note the vessel's credit rating will improve sequentially from 4 to 6, and then stepwise from 7 up to 12. I'll endeavor to adjust the credit rating from 10 to 6, coordinating with a colleague.

Please let me know if this arrangement works for you so we can proceed to formalize it.

Best regards,
Captain G

Additionally, you are required to place the FOB cargo on 5 vessels from our fleet for 15 days post-payment to validate your intent and capability to proceed. Full completion of cargo loading procedures must be communicated in writing within 3 days after the task is accomplished.

email_chain.subject: Re: Re: Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipping Rates

email_chain.subject: Final Steps for Transaction Closure
email_chain.body: To finalize the transaction, upon advance payment, we require confirmation and detailed reports on the cargo placement. We also need evidence such as photographs of the cargo on the vessels. Furthermore, our office in Latvia expects to receive, within 5 days post your receipt of the balance, full contracts of carriage along with all shipping documents from the charter parties involved. All documents must be signed and delivered to our office within the specified timeframe.

email_chain.subject: Difficulty with FormsModule in Angular 2
email_chain.body: I'm having trouble implementing the [email] type in my input fields using Angular 2. I've already imported FormsModule as per the installation guide, but I'm unsure how to correctly declare it in @NgModule and the actual input tag.

email_chain.subject: Re: Difficulty with FormsModule in Angular 2
email_chain.body: To integrate the FormsModule into your Angular 2 application, you need to import FormsModule from '@angular/forms' first. Then, include FormsModule in the imports array within your @NgModule declaration, as such: imports: [ BrowserModule, FormsModule ]. Finally, ensure your input tag is correctly formatted, for example, <input type='email'> which sets the input’s type to email.

email_chain.subject: Re: Re: Difficulty with FormsModule in Angular 2
email_chain.body: Thanks for the quick reply! I followed your instructions and updated the @NgModule declaration with FormsModule and confirmed the type of the input tag is correctly set to 'email'. However, I'm still experiencing issues. Is there any additional configuration that I might be missing?

email_chain.subject: Re: Re: Re: Difficulty with FormsModule in Angular 2
email_chain.body: It sounds like you've followed all the necessary steps correctly. Make sure there are no typos and rebuild your project. If the issue persists, could you provide more details about the error message you are receiving? It will help us diagnose and solve your issue more effectively.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Gasoil Transportation
email_chain.body: Dear Phyllis, It appears you are seeking quotes for the shipment of 30,000MT of gasoil from Houston to Singapore. The most suitable vessel type would be a Suezmax due to size constraints, which we can arrange from Houston. The latest quotation for a Suezmax vessel from Houston to Singapore as of April 28, 2005, is as follows: Vessel holds up to 130,000 m3, with a deadweight tonnage at 0.8 Tpc, sulphur content of 4.2% and a maximum of 130 ppm S, viscosity not exceeding 60 ppm. Residue must not exceed 2% of cargo by weight, with an additional maximum of 0.5% for other elements. Please confirm whether this meets your requirements. Sincerely, Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Refractive Index Equations
email_chain.body: I was interested in your article about reflective materials in Nature. You had two equations for refractive index in the article. I am trying to find a proof or derivation of one of these equations (the one that uses lambda and n) and was wondering if you could direct me to a reference for it. Thank you, Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Refractive Index Equations
email_chain.body: Hi Daniel, Thank you for your interest. The equation n=1-sqrt(1-f)/2 is quite general and can be found in most electromagnetism and optics books. I included a reference to this equation in my Nature paper on page 3, but you might also find further details in more recent books on plasmonics, such as those written by Jain.

email_chain.subject: Follow-up: Equation Derivation
email_chain.body: Hello, Do you have any notes or references for the derivation of the equation, where n=4*Pi/lambda*d*n*d? Thanks. Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up: Equation Derivation
email_chain.body: Hi Daniel, The derivation you're asking about isn't detailed on this platform. However, you might find the necessary information in two sources: (1) P. Drude, 'Handbuch der Radiologie', Barth, Leipzig, 1922, page 369, and (2) N. Jain, C.J. Kryzhanovsky, and C.H. Chen's work in 'Excitation and Detection of Surface Plasmons on Gold Films', part of 'Coherence, Statistics, and Quantum Optics IV', edited by T. Zimmermann, and A. Berger, Springer, 2005, pages 146-165.

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up: Equation Derivation
email_chain.body: Hi Wim, Thanks for your reply. I found and reviewed those references, but I'm still searching for a clearer derivation that shows how the refractive index is related to frequency, lambda, and the amplitude. Best regards, Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Re: Follow-up: Equation Derivation
email_chain.body: Hi Daniel, Unfortunately, I am unsure if there's a clearer derivation available in literature. Other texts might offer what you're looking for but could fall short of clarity. It would be beneficial if someone well-versed in this topic could provide a detailed derivation here. Best, Wim

email_chain.subject: Email Etiquette and Movie Discussion
email_chain.body: Good afternoon. I hope this email finds you well. Thank you for the informative video, it was very helpful. I have a question about email etiquette; is it appropriate to use "This is" to introduce myself in emails? Also, I recently watched a fascinating movie about a cat with magical abilities. Have you seen it? It was quite enjoyable! Thanks a lot. Kevin

email_chain.subject: Re: Email Etiquette and Movie Discussion
email_chain.body: Hello Kevin, Thank you for the lovely song. Your friend Kevin has a great voice, and your English is impressive. Using 'This is' to introduce your message is acceptable. For example, 'This is a song my friend Kevin sings.' You can certainly ask about or discuss movies like that! 'How was the movie about the cat with magical abilities?' I'm glad you enjoyed it. Have a great day! Best regards, Olivia and the Yip sisters.

email_chain.subject: Analysis of Acquisition Plans and Current Business Operations
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Flippo,

I appreciate the discussion pertaining to our current analysis of business options and the potential acquisition of the additional 15% stake. As this decision entails significant strategic implications, additional time is necessary to reach an informed conclusion. Rest assured, the remaining aspects of our operations continue unaffected, with the Board of Directors maintaining full oversight.

Kind regards,
Jason McGroarty
RBC Capital Markets
(416) 842-6293

email_chain.subject: Re: Analysis of Acquisition Plans and Current Business Operations - REMOVAL OF ASSETS FROM CONTROLS OF ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

I was copied on your email yesterday to Mr. Frank and Messrs. Calloway and Vaughn. Please be advised that pursuant to Section 14.4 of the Purchase Agreement dated November 4, 2004, we have placed certain assets, which are subject to the transfer agreement you recently sent over, in our depository at 15 York St., Toronto. These assets are listed in our attachment from the email dated December 14, 2004. Should you have any objections to this storage, please inform us accordingly.

email_chain.subject: Re: Analysis of Acquisition Plans and Current Business Operations - REMOVAL OF ASSETS FROM CONTROLS OF ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Flippo,

Thank you for your prompt response. We acknowledge no objections to the listed assets. However, it has come to our attention that this list has not yet been reviewed by ABC's Board of Directors. It appears some files and information retained may not comply with the Sale Agreement's stipulations. Further, your proposal to place these assets in a depository pending their return raises concerns about the adherence to the Sale Agreement, specifically Section 2.1(a).

Please clarify these points at your earliest convenience.

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Breach of Sale Agreement and Asset Mismanagement
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

Following our earlier correspondence and a discussion today with Martin, I need to express serious concerns. As of today, December 17, 2004, ABC is unlawfully distributing assets and information to various third parties and law firms without an approved and executed sale agreement. This approach cannot be accepted. Please provide a detailed list of all assets and the names of third parties involved immediately.

email_chain.subject: Final Notice: Asset Handling and Compliance with Purchase Agreement
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Flippo,

In light of your concerns, it is imperative to clarify that RBC Capital Markets is acting solely as a custodian, not a trading partner, holding ABC's assets until the transaction concludes. Any claim that ABC has breached the purchase agreement is unwarranted. I urge ABC to cease transferring assets and to rectify any actions contrary to our agreement.

Best regards,
Jason McGroarty

email_chain.subject: Reviewing Freight Contract: Rotterdam to Naples
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Gonzales,

Our team has been reviewing the contract for freight containers shipped between Rotterdam and Naples for some weeks now. Could you please share any further business questions or suggestions related to our market analysis?

Regards,
Christa

email_chain.subject: Re: Reviewing Freight Contract: Rotterdam to Naples
email_chain.body:
Morning Christa,

If I recall correctly, the original contract specified only containers shipped by steam ship. However, considering steam ships have largely been replaced by modern container ships, I'd like to amend the contract to include all types of modern container ships, and address an expiration date for this change.

Regards,
Hugo

email_chain.subject: Re: Reviewing Freight Contract: Rotterdam to Naples
email_chain.body:
Hi Hugo,

Indeed, this is a valid concern. I've reviewed some historical documentation from the 1970s that states steam ships were still a common mode of container transport, despite their inefficiencies and higher operation costs. It's an important aspect to consider.

What do you think? 

Regards,
Christa

email_chain.subject: Re: Reviewing Freight Contract: Rotterdam to Naples
email_chain.body:
Hi Christa,

That observation is accurate. The operation of steam ships, especially the vibrations from steam engines and potential leaks from the boilers, presents a high risk of damage to most containers in transit. This underlines the necessity of transitioning to modern container ships for better safety and efficiency.

Best,
Hugo

email_chain.subject: Enquiry about Shipping Capacity and Pricing for T-shirts
email_chain.body: Hello, we are looking to ship 200 cartons of T-shirts from Shanghai to Paris. Could you please let us know if you have space available this month and how soon we can get a price quote? Regards, Jean

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry about Shipping Capacity and Pricing for T-shirts
email_chain.body: Hi Jean, Thank you for reaching out. Before I can provide a detailed quote, could you please provide some additional information regarding the T-shirts? Specifically: 1) Brand/Mark of the T-shirts? 2) Type (Tank, Tube, Long Sleeve, Short Sleeve)? 3) Fabric (Knitted or Woven) and the type of knit or weave? 4) Any special decorations? Type of decorations? 5) Fabric specifics such as denier, threads, and fiber count? 6) Weight per T-shirt? 7) Payment preference for freight costs – do you want it on your invoice or will we handle it? 8) Number of items per package? Feel free to reach out with any questions. Best regards, Yue

email_chain.subject: Cargo Shipment Proposal: Pengerang to Las Palmas
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Walters,

We have a cargo of 12,000MT of urea that needs shipping from Pengerang to Las Palmas in September. Historically, the Bunker Adjustment Factor (BAF) was around $120/MT, but due to recent changes, we expect variances. Please be advised that if a vessel with high Gross DeadWeight (GdW) is used, it will likely impact the schedule and might cause delays.

Please let us know your preferences or any other specifics you need. Looking forward to your prompt response.

Best Regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Continued Discussion on Urea Purchase and Shipping Requirements
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Walters,

We are still coordinating with our vendors in Nanded and expect to finalize pricing for up to 20,000MT of various types of urea by the end of next week. As market conditions are volatile, the quantities may fluctuate daily. We request you to share the last two digits of your credit card for verification purposes. Additionally, I will contact you later today to discuss potential travel arrangements to Mumbai and further details of the urea types and quantities required.

We anticipate organizing the shipment in three or four batches. Please share a list of available vessels and any specific requirements you might have.

Looking forward to our meeting.

Best Regards,
Jane

email_chain.body:

Additionally, it's not feasible to arrange transportation by boat under these conditions. As an alternative, I suggest waiting until the next hurricane season when the rates may decrease.

Let me know if you need help with planning or if you'd like quotes for different routes or timings.

Best wishes,
Paul

- Miami to Belize: $225 per MT
- Miami to Trinidad: $270 per MT
- Miami to Cozumel: $275 per MT
- Miami to Puerto Rico: $180 per MT
- Miami to Havana: $165 per MT
- Miami to Venezuela: $240 per MT
- Miami to Guantanamo: $175 per MT
- Miami to Bahamas: $235 per MT
- Miami to Colombia: $250 per MT
- Miami to Curacao: $220 per MT

Please let me know if any of these options are of interest to you, or if you need additional information.

Best regards,

Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Scrap Steel Delivery from Singapore to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Hi Scott,

Thanks for getting in touch. We are interested in the 2,500mt of scrap metal you mentioned. We typically source from Malaysia, but since your ship is already in Singapore and headed for Osaka, this aligns well with our logistics chain.

Can you provide more details on the steel grades and specify the lengths? Also, could you give us an estimated delivery schedule?

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Scrap Steel Delivery from Singapore to Osaka
email_chain.body:

We can arrange for a sample upon request. Please let us know how to proceed.

Kind regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Vessel Operations between Gdynia and Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Dear Operations Team,

I would like to inquire if the vessel scheduled for loading in Gdynia can return to Liverpool and unload on the same day.
Please advise if this is feasible considering the operational hours and transit times.

Additionally, I would like to be informed about the mandatory pilot and towage services as required for tankers in Sulzheim and Ettlingen, and other terminals in the Rhine region. Could you also clarify if the pilotage fees by EUROTUG are different for vessels with shorter draft?

Looking forward to your guidance.

Best regards,
Noa

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Vessel Operations between Gdynia and Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hello Noa,

Thank you for reaching out with your questions.

Regarding your query about the vessel's operations from Gdynia to Liverpool, it is generally not feasible for a vessel to complete both loading in Gdynia and unloading in Liverpool on the same day due to the transit time required. Please let us know if there are specific dates or arrangements you are considering.

As for the pilot services, it is correct that pilots are mandatory for tankers in Sulzheim and Ettlingen. Additionally, in all Rhine region terminals, pilot services are required for vessels over a certain draft or without a canal-certified ship's master. Regarding the EUROTUG pilotage fees, they vary based on the draft length of the vessel. We suggest contacting EUROTUG directly for the most accurate fee estimate.

Please do not hesitate to get back to us with any further queries or specific vessel details.

Best regards,
Operations Team

Looks like there are some port delays going through Kandla. We only have tonnage fixed to Mumbai/Kochi. The next most recent port availability is Chennai. Do you have any interest in loading at Chennai? 

Best Regards,
Liam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Petcoke Transport from Kandla to Mathura

Hi Liam,

Thanks for your reply. How about Mumbai for delivery? That would be acceptable to us.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Petcoke Transport from Kandla to Mathura
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

We only have one vessel in the Gulf that could arrive in Mumbai within your timeframes. It will be in Lasbela (Mub) on 11th July and can be ready to load on the 13th or 14th July. However, it is currently chartered and the berth time will be a minimum of 10 days. After loading, the ship could sail straight to Mathura, though please note it might have 1-2 days at anchor in Mumbai, plus waiting for the berth to be available.

Best Regards,
Liam

Thank you for your interest. I have since received an enquiry for a different cargo type that the ship could load in Mumbai, so I'm going to offer it to that client instead. Unfortunately, that means it's not going to be available for your cargo.

Please let me know if you are still interested and I will check if there are other vessels that could load at Mumbai.

Liam

email_chain.subject: Request for Bill of Lading and PRE-Arrival Notification Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Pal,

Could you please confirm if we can proceed with the EXW delivery terms for your import? If possible, kindly provide a copy of the bill of lading as soon as available. Please ensure you have also sent a pre-arrival notification including the cargo and the owner's details, to help us prepare the berth and manage the required documentation efficiently.

Looking forward to your prompt response,
Yi-shen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Bill of Lading and PRE-Arrival Notification Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Yi-shen,

Thank you for your email. We can indeed deliver the import cargo under EXW terms, though our suppliers can also handle CIF terms. However, since our cargo is already loaded and considering the potential increase in transportation costs under CIF, we prefer EXW for this shipment.

Regarding the bill of lading, could you specify whether providing a copy before the cargo's arrival poses any issues? Additionally, as we are supplying high-technology components and your export will be the final user, we are unsure about how to complete the other documentation.

Thanks for your assistance,
Terry

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Bill of Lading and PRE-Arrival Notification Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Terry,

We do require the bill of lading to be sent to us before the cargo's arrival. It is essential to include information regarding the final user and the manufacturer of the products on the bill of lading. Please provide this information at your earliest convenience.

Regards,
Yi-shen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Bill of Lading and PRE-Arrival Notification Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Yi-shen,

Thank you for your reply. Unfortunately, we are unable to disclose the details of the final user, as the purchase of our product is for internal use only. Additionally, we are not permitted to reveal the manufacturer's name.

We regret any inconvenience this may cause.

Best Regards,
Terry

email_chain.subject: Instruction to Import Shipping Email Dataset
email_chain.body: To import a Shipping Email dataset, please select EMAILS in the Model section on the menu bar. If you have not saved your file yet, begin by selecting the first tab in the bottom section of the view menu. Then, click on the plus button and select 'Import Dataset'. You will then be directed to choose a file. At this point, a good action is to download the dataset from the FISAI_22 assignment page and select the file named Shipping Emails.xlsx. Once the upload is completed, you can check your data. Each shipping email in the dataset will be represented by two different elements:\n(Value, Time of writing, Sender, Recipient, Port of Departure, Port of Arrival)\n(Value) (Time of writing) Mr/Ms (Sender) [Hamburg] Hi (Recipient), (Message)

email_chain.subject: Re: Instruction to Import Shipping Email Dataset
email_chain.body: Thank you for the instructions on how to import the Shipping Emails dataset. I have followed the steps and successfully uploaded the file. I can now view my data as instructed, where each shipping email is detailed with the elements you described. I appreciate your assistance!

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Shipping Details and Charges
email_chain.body:
Hello Grace,

We have received your irrevocable letter of credit and the instructions for the bill of lading. The shipping rate will be USD 700 per 20-foot container. We will issue the bill of lading to bearer and send the bill of lading along with other shipping documents to you within five days of confirming the receipt of the letter of credit in our London account.

Best regards,
Ben

email_chain.subject: Request for Travel Costs from Chicago to Charleston
email_chain.body:
Hello Gloria,

Could you give me some pricing options for a trip from Chicago to Charleston?

Kind regards,
Marshall

email_chain.subject: Quote for your trip from Chicago to Charleston
email_chain.body:
Hello Marshall,

Here are the travel details:
- Departure from Chicago: 25 Aug 2013
- Arrival in Charleston: 26 Aug 2013
- Return from Charleston to Chicago: 31 Aug 2013

Pricing options are as follows:
- Roundtrip ticket: $845.00
- One-way ticket to Charleston: $430.00

Please note, the maximum stops allowed by the airlines are up to 2. We cannot offer itineraries with more than 2 stops.

Best regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about the travel itinerary with multiple stops
email_chain.body:
Hello Gloria,

Upon reviewing your options, could we explore a routing that includes a stopover in Honolulu on the return trip? Previously, you mentioned the limitation of stops. Please confirm if this is a possibility or suggest any alternative with a new quote.

Best regards,
Richard

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about the travel itinerary with multiple stops
email_chain.body:
Hi Richard,

As per airline regulations, the maximum number of stops allowed is two. Unfortunately, incorporating Honolulu as a stopover is not possible under the current policies. If you are considering different options, I would be happy to assist further.

Regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Quote Request for Hydrogen Sulphide Shipment
email_chain.body:

Can you provide a CFR quote for a 10kt shipment of hydrogen sulphide to Vladivostok? Please include vessel options, laycan periods, and stock availability.

Kind regards,
Maya

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Request for Hydrogen Sulphide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Maya,

Could you please provide more details about the cargo, specifically the delivery method?

Best,
Adi

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Request for Hydrogen Sulphide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Adi,

Thank you for your response. The cargo is gaseous hydrogen sulphide (CAS 7783-06-4) shipping from Shahpour Tank to Vladivostok, CFR terms on m.v.

Kind regards,
Maya

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Request for Hydrogen Sulphide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Maya,

I'm preparing a quote on m.v. Auriga Glory for discharge from 01 to 20 September. Please specify laycan from 01 to 15 September. Additionally, I need full chemical details of the cargo to proceed as there are new regulations effective end of September concerning the transport of H2S.

Best regards,
Adi

email_chain.subject: Awaiting Payment for Shipment of Coal
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Meng,

We are still awaiting payment for your shipment of coal from last month. Can you verify the transaction and provide us with a value date for the payment?

Warm regards,
Miguel

email_chain.subject: Re: Awaiting Payment for Shipment of Coal
email_chain.body:
Hello Miguel,

This is Jian Li from the Shanghai Port Authority. Mr. Meng has delegated me to address your concerns regarding the payment. He informed me that he has already processed the payment. However, it seems you have not received it yet. We would appreciate it if you could confirm the amount that was meant to cover the shipment.

Thank you in advance for your cooperation.

Warm regards,
Jian Li

email_chain.subject: Re: Awaiting Payment for Shipment of Coal
email_chain.body:
Dear Jian,

I am the Chief Financial Officer for the company, handling communications in Miguel's absence. I have reviewed our records, and currently, there is no evidence of a received payment for the shipment in question. Could you please check on your end?

Best regards,
[Name of CFO]

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quote: Bitumen from Bahrain to Mombasa
email_chain.body: Dear Marcus, Could you provide a freight quote for transporting 6,800MT of bitumen from Bahrain to Mombasa, targeted for mid-July? Additionally, what are your expectations concerning port congestion around that timeframe in your area? Thank you, Gabrielle

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Quote: Bitumen from Bahrain to Mombasa
email_chain.body: Hello Gabrielle, Thank you for reaching out. We are currently preparing your freight quote. However, the price is influenced by the chosen export terms such as CIF, MFF, or OFO, not to mention freight insurance requirements. We will provide more details once finalized. Kind Regards, Marcus

email_chain.subject: Availability for LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jiang,

We have available tonnage for 6000 MT of LPG from the Middle East to Ulsan, subject to availability of space.

Best regards,
Harriet

email_chain.subject: Availability for LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jiang,

Following our previous email, I would like to reiterate that we currently have the capacity to transport 6000 MT of LPG from the Middle East to Ulsan. This offer is subject to space availability on the vessels.

Please let us know if you are interested.

Best regards,
Harriet

email_chain.subject: Request for Additional Vessel Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jiang,

Thank you for your response. We would appreciate if you could forward the Time Charter Equivalent (TCE) rates and drawings of your vessels to evaluate the suitability for our cargo of LPG.

Looking forward to your prompt reply.

Best regards,
Harriet

email_chain.subject: Request for Contract Conditions
email_chain.body:
Mr. Jiang,

Please send your latest LPG Bareboat Charter (BP T/C) terms based on our outlined conditions.

Regards,
Harriet

email_chain.subject: Clarification on L/C Value

Can you confirm the L/C value of the order? We have two different values in our records. If you confirm the value, it will be easier for us to verify the total amount.

Thanks,
Alan & Adam
On Behalf of Debtor Adviser

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on L/C Value
email_chain.body:
Dear Alan & Adam,

No worries, I confirm that the L/C value of the order is $500. Please assist us in completing the sales and let us know when the sales are completed and when the L/C is received.

Best regards,
Patrick
Fintech Consulting Group Inc.

email_chain.subject: Attached L/C Copy for Records
email_chain.body:
Good morning Ms. Taylor,

Attached is the L/C copy for your records. I will notify you as soon as the sales are completed.

Kind regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Toluene Shipment from Rotterdam to Shanghai
email_chain.body: Hello Ms. John, We plan to move 1,500MT of toluene from Rotterdam to Shanghai this month. Could you please share your available dates and inform us of any additional storage surcharge? Best regards, Andrey

email_chain.subject: Re: Toluene Shipment from Rotterdam to Shanghai
email_chain.body: Hi Andrey, I'm currently tied up. Can we continue this discussion later? Regards, Ms. John

email_chain.subject: Re: Toluene Shipment from Rotterdam to Shanghai
email_chain.body: Dear Ms. John, Could we schedule a chat to discuss the shipment details perhaps on Sunday? Best, Andrey

email_chain.subject: Re: Toluene Shipment from Rotterdam to Shanghai
email_chain.body: Dear Andrey, Sunday will not work for me. Can we aim for a discussion on Monday instead? Best, Ms. John

email_chain.subject: Re: Toluene Shipment from Rotterdam to Shanghai
email_chain.body: Hi Ms. John, I just learned my flight has been canceled. Can we chat this evening instead? Regards, Andrey

email_chain.subject: Re: Toluene Shipment from Rotterdam to Shanghai
email_chain.body: I'm not available this evening. Could we possibly meet on Friday to discuss further? Regards, Ms. John

email_chain.subject: Re: Toluene Shipment from Rotterdam to Shanghai
email_chain.body: Dear Ms. John, Confirming our phone discussion for this coming Friday. Thank you, Andrey

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quote - Sharjah to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipping Contacts,

In October, we have 8,500 MT of crude oil to ship from Sharjah to Mombasa. Please provide a freight quote, including any transit charges. We anticipate loading between the 14th and 30th of October, though we can be flexible. Thanks for your help.

If you have questions, please call my assistant in London.

Best regards,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Urgency in Shipping Timelines
email_chain.body:
Dear Nicholas,

Could you please inquire with the freight company about how quickly we can ship from Sharjah to Mombasa? We are in a rush and any help would be much appreciated. 

Best regards,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Request for Company Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. M,

With reference to the inquiry sent to you on behalf of Isaac, kindly provide your company details: your name, phone and fax number, and company name, so that I may add your company to our contact database.

Thank you.

Best regards,
Mrs. Busra Öztürk

email_chain.subject: Insurance Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Busra Öztürk,

Freight insurance has been arranged and we will also need to insure our goods for shipping. The cost will be 5 percent of the total cost. Could you please confirm whether your company can provide this insurance?

Kind regards,
Mrs. M

email_chain.subject: Final Confirmation and Insurance Requirement
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lincoln,

I am pleased to confirm that we will be loading in Sharjah on 20th October and we hope to load 8,500 MT of crude oil. Our freight is at the rates you sent us. We have checked with our insurers and they are fine with your quote. They have requested an additional form, which we have filled in and scanned. Please email me this form as soon as possible. Also, could you send a copy of your marine insurance policy to our insurers to confirm it covers our cargo? We are very excited to work with your company.

Kind regards,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Transport Inquiry for Soybean Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Liang,

How much would it cost to transport 15,000MT of soybean oil from Gulf of Kuantan to Busan by the 30th of December? Please send your quote to me.

Thanks,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Inquiry for Soybean Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Gary,

Unfortunately, due to high demand, most of our tanker fleet is occupied. However, we are prioritizing your request and will provide a quote by the middle of next week.

Best wishes,
Ms. Liang

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Inquiry for Soybean Oil - Urgent Rate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Liang,

I appreciate your efforts, but I require the rates urgently. Please put me on the waiting list for the next available charter and try to expedite the quotation process to meet my deadline by this Thursday.

Thank you for your cooperation,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Rate Request - Transport Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Gary,

Good news! We've had a few cancellations and can now offer a charter. The rate for transporting the soybean oil per barrel is $18,000. A vessel will be available to carry your cargo on Friday. Please review and confirm the vessel details upon accepting the contract.

Looking forward to your confirmation,
Ms. Liang

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Charter Details - Transport of Soybean Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Liang,

I've reviewed the contract from the charter company and will proceed with the signing. However, I need to present the final quotation to our president for approval. Can you please provide that?

Thanks,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Final Quotation Request for Soybean Oil Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Gary,

The final quotation for transporting 15,000MT of soybean oil to Busan is confirmed at $18,000 per barrel. Please present this to your president, and let us know if there are further details needed.

Best regards,
Ms. Liang

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry for Petroleum Coke Transport from Baku to Qingdao
email_chain.body: Hello, We are looking to charter a vessel to transport 2000 MT of petroleum coke from Baku to Qingdao, China in November. Do you have any ships available during that period? Regards, [Name]

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for Petroleum Coke Transport from Baku to Qingdao
email_chain.body: Hello, For petroleum coke transport, I can offer a spot charter rate of $0.19/MT plus a bunker adjustment factor of $0.05/MT. The loading will occur in Baku, with delivery to Qingdao, China in November. The shipment will involve a total of 20,000 MT, with the bill of lading 100% paid. Please confirm if this meets your requirements. Best regards, [Name]

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for Petroleum Coke Transport from Baku to Qingdao
email_chain.body: Hi, The information looks good. To clarify, the offered price of $0.19/MT for shipping costs includes the mention of a bunker fee of $0.05/MT, making it seem as if we are paying for the bunker separately. Is this for renting the vessel or an additional cost on top of the charter rate? Also, can you confirm the total expected cost for chartering the vessel? Thanks, [Name]

labels.cargo_size: 2000 MT initially mentioned, corrected to 20000 MT

email_chain.subject: Wheat Shipment Offer from Tanzania to Marseilles
email_chain.body:
Hello Jonathan,

Would you be interested in a 1,500MT parcel of wheat from Tanzania to Marseilles?

Regards,
Sonny

email_chain.subject: Attached ICC Survey for Your Review
email_chain.body:
Hello Jonathan,

Thank you for your response yesterday.
Attached you'll find the ICC survey for your review. Please let me know of any issues. 

Are you available this weekend?

Regards,
Sonny

email_chain.subject: Away From Office - Reviewing Documents
email_chain.body:
Hi Sonny, thank you for the documents and apologies for the late reply. I'm actually away at the moment and won't be back until Monday morning. I look forward to going over the docs this weekend.

Regards,
Jonathan

email_chain.subject: Review Completed - Questions Regarding Chartering
email_chain.body:
Hi Sonny,

Thank you for the docs. I've had a good look over them and as soon as I get back from my holiday, I'll send over the SWIFT. In the meantime, can you please send me the bank statement for this account? Also, please let me know if your contract allows me to use a chartered vessel as a third party, or if I have to work with a co-agent? If you need me to clarify, my chartering terms are on the front of the contract.

Regards,
Jonathan

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Earthquake Damage to Shipment
email_chain.body:
What is happening? My shipment of peppers got destroyed due to an earthquake. Please advise.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Earthquake Damage to Shipment
email_chain.body:
> What is happening? My shipment of peppers got destroyed due to an earthquake. Please advise. Best regards, Mike

Hello Mike,

Thank you for your inquiry. Our goal is to provide each and every one of our customers the best possible service experience and we regret that in this instance we fell short. Our supervisor in Seattle, Scott Jones, will be contacting you to discuss the situation further and will be issuing you a refund for the shipment. We hope that you will allow us the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Warm regards,
Loyalty Team
FedEx Express
7671 Roswell Rd. Bldg. A Suite 100
Atlanta, GA 30350

email_chain.subject: Request for HFO and MGO Quotes for Abu Dhabi and Muscat

email_chain.subject: Request for CFR Quote to India
email_chain.body:
Good evening Mr. Taylor,

The customer has requested us to ship 1,000 metric tonnes of RME from Fujairah to India on a Handymax vessel. The cargo must arrive by 1st October. Please provide your best quote based on CFR terms as soon as possible.

Thanks,
Louis

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for CFR Quote to India - Terms and Conditions
email_chain.body:
Dear Louis,

A proposal for CIF and FOB terms are as follows: Please note that for CIF and FOB, we will not offer any competitive discount. For terms CPT, CFR, or FOB, the vessel will be ready for sea on 19th August. Payment terms are Cash at Sight with T/T transferring 100% to the seller's account or an irrevocable L/C confirmed by a prime ARA rated bank at 110% of the C&F value.

For C&F terms, we will quote the FOB price minus the CIF freight at actual cost plus a $75 loading fee at Fujairah.

For further details on terms and conditions, please see the attached file.

Have a good day!

Best regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Inquiry for Styrene Monomer Shipment
email_chain.body:
